[Embarrassing Tattoo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmbarrassingTattoo): If romanced by Shepard, she jokes in *3* that she's gotten an N7 tattoo on her ass.
[Enemy Mine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnemyMine): Puts her hatred towards Cerberus aside since they both have a common enemy.

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): When she's released from cryo-stasis, Shepard's team is shocked that the Jack they've been hearing so much about is a scrawny little woman covered in tattoos. Then she wakes up, destroys *three* [YMIR mechs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumongousMecha) and goes on a rampage across Purgatory.

[Everyone Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneHasStandards): She is slightly troubled by Shepard urging Niftu Cal, the "Biotic God," to get himself killed, even though she admits it was kind of funny.
QUOTE **Jack:** That was *mean*... but damn funny.

[Evil Cannot Comprehend Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCannotComprehendGood): She immediately assumes that Shepard's attempts to get to know her have an angle of some kind. She almost-immediately propositions a male Shepard, assuming he's only chatting her up to get into her pants.  (SPOILER) Accepting locks you out of her Romance, something Kelly will warn you about . Her coming to grips with the fact that Shepard's concern stems from genuine altruism, or even love, is a big part of her [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment).

[Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart): While not pure evil, she's basically a dark reflection of Kaidan Alenko from the first game. Only replace the Alliance-run BaAT bootcamp with a rogue Cerberus facility, being surrounded by friends with solitary confinement, where the other children are *afraid* of you, and the grueling training with surgical experimentation and outright *torture*.

[Evil Feels Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilFeelsGood): At least that's what she would most likely tell you. It turns out that she doesn't exactly have a choice; Cerberus conditioned her to feel that way.
QUOTE **Jack:** I still get warm feelings during a fight.

[Evil Is Petty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilIsPetty): Her fight with Miranda in a nutshell. [Cold as Miranda acts,](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickTheDog) Jack was still looking for a fight there and was only causing trouble because she wanted to hear Miranda admit that what Cerberus did to her was wrong. And if Shepard chooses not to take her side, you lose her loyalty (though the same is also true of Miranda if you side with Jack). Granted, Jack had a more justifiable reason to be offended, as Miranda's loyalty had nothing to do with her allegiance to Cerberus anyway.
[Exposed to the Elements](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExposedToTheElements): Jack wears [stripperiffic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperiffic) outfits *in space*.

[Expository Hairstyle Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpositoryHairstyleChange): You see her again in *Mass Effect 3* with her hair on top grown out long enough for a short pony tail. She still keeps her temples shaved.

[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): Several aspects of her character mirror those of [Jack B. Badd](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/TheChroniclesOfRiddick), being a bald female convict and runaway <sup>note </sup>  although the latter grew her hair out sometime after being convicted  who developed into a [Bruiser with a Soft Center](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BruiserWithASoftCenter) as she grew older. The emphasis of her [Gender Reveal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenderReveal) upon her introduction also parallels the latter character's reveal as a girl, which was one of the major twists of *[Pitch Black](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/PitchBlack)* when it first came out in theaters.
[Eye Color Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EyeColorChange): In ME3, her eyes turn blue when she uses her biotics.
[Fantastic Drug](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasticDrug): Red sand [in dummied-out content.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatCouldHaveBeen)

[Fetishized Abuser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FetishizedAbuser): If Shepard tries to romance and show he cares about her, she treats him like utter shit and snaps completely if she does drive him away, but ends up in perhaps the most touching romance scene if [Shepard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoggedNiceGuy) can [persevere.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator)
[Fluffy Tamer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FluffyTamer): Shows up with a biotic varren from Thessia in the Citadel DLC.
[For the Evulz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForTheEvulz): Her motivation a lot of the time.  (SPOILER)  She grows out of it .

[Forceful Kiss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForcefulKiss): At the start of her optional casual sex scene with Shepard, she shoves him against the wall and then rushes toward him, grabbing him and forcing a deep kiss on his lips.

[Freaky Is Cool](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreakyIsCool): She doesn't understand why Paragon Shepard wants to form a romantic relationship with her, but admits the idea is intriguing.
QUOTE **Jack:** ([Smiling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenSheSmiles)) You're weird Shepard. That kinda gets me off.

[Freudian Excuse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianExcuse): She's got a particularly dark and grisly one for her backstory that explains her bloodlust and extremely antisocial nature. And also her [Roaring Rampage of Revenge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoaringRampageOfRevenge) against Cerberus.

[From Nobody to Nightmare](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FromNobodyToNightmare): Started out as a normal little girl. Years of being tortured and used has turned her into one of the galaxy's most notorious criminals.

[Gameplay and Story Segregation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation): Don't try to have Jack take on YMIR Mechs by herself. It won't end pretty, since she's basically a [Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon) with a lot more glass than cannon, especially against mechanical enemies.
[Gender-Blender Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenderBlenderName): Lampshaded when she is first seen, and then never mentioned again.  (SPOILER)  Subverted, however, by her real name, Jennifer .
[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): She's very powerful offensively, but she's very frail in combat, second only to Kasumi.
[Gone Horribly Right](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoneHorriblyRight): Cerberus got what they wanted.

[Good Feels Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodFeelsGood): She starts to succumb to this after her [Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn). Teaching biotic kids like her really makes her understand why good feels better than evil.

[Good Scars, Evil Scars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodScarsEvilScars): She has significant scarring on her neck from the Teltin experiments. In the third game, if Shepard chooses the Renegade response to Rodriguez questioning whether Cerberus could be telling the truth about not harming people who surrender to them, Jack angrily shoves her scars into Rodriguez's face to prove what they do to people half her age.

[Goth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Goth): Thinks very little of herself? Check. [Cynical](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCynic)? Check. Loves deep, emotional poetry? Check. Full of emotional scars? Check. An admiration for death? Check. Wears pale makeup and black eyeliner? Check. Covered in beautiful tattoos that reflect her inner pain? Check. [Hell-Bent for Leather](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellBentForLeather)? Check. Feared for being [a loner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonersAreFreaks)? Check.

[Goth Girls Know Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GothGirlsKnowMagic): Jack shows shades of being a [Goth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Goth) with her [penchant for leather clothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellBentForLeather) and her personality fitting the [Lone Psycho](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonersAreFreaks) type. She's also one of the most powerful human biotic in the [The 'Verse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheVerse).
[Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn): A very gradual process that isn't fully completed until after *2*.

[Hell-Bent for Leather](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellBentForLeather):
    - Both her loyalty and alternate [Badass Biker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBiker) DLC outfit in *2*. - Wears a studded leather jacket in her new job as a (SPOILER) [Badass Teacher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassTeacher) in *3*. According to (SPOILER) Kahlee Sanders , it's as far as Jack is willing to compromise on the dress-code required for (SPOILER) Grissom Academy's faculty members .

[Hidden Buxom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenBuxom): That strap Jack has covering her chest on her default appearance is actually used as a constrictor binding her breasts to make them appear small because she doesn't like men checking her out. Ironically, not much is covered up since she doesn't wear a shirt. But, her appearance in *3* shows Jack's full endowment.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): A Paragon Shep will peel away her layers, and even her voice will reflect this, as it goes from rough and masculine to soft and feminine by the time a romance is completed. At the end of the game, if she survives, no matter what her loyalty is, she'll give Shepard a determined nod, which is tantamount to a salute — and this was a woman who had *no* interest in *anything* or *anyone* but herself.
    - The Shadow Broker DLC also reveals that she writes poetry in her spare time under the pseudonym "Jacqueline Nought".

[Hideous Hangover Cure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HideousHangoverCure): Averted. She reveals in the Citadel DLC thanks to her conditioning, she never feels any sort of morning-after hangover effects. She's *exercising* when she's first met up with after the party.

[Incompletely Trained](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncompletelyTrained): The Pragia facility was shut down long before they could finish. With no one to fill in the gaps in her biotic abilities, Jack trained herself to use weapons instead.

[I Need a Freaking Drink](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/INeedAFreakingDrink): In the *Citadel* DLC, if Shepard suggests to Jack that she and Miranda should [kiss and make up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BelligerentSexualTension).

[In Love with Your Carnage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InLoveWithYourCarnage): Summed up in this line from the *Citadel* DLC:
QUOTE  **Jack:** *[after blowing up an Atlas mech]* If there's a God, that's what she sounds like. Just a big, deep "BWOOM!" to let you know everything's gonna be okay.
[Institutional Apparel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstitutionalApparel): Her starting outfit is the remains of her Purgatory uniform.
[Intimate Marks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntimateMarks): Everything below the neck is covered in ink, including her breasts.
[In-Universe Catharsis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InUniverseCatharsis): Pretty much the entire point of her loyalty mission. The achievement for gaining her loyalty is even called "Catharsis."

[I Reject Your Reality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IRejectYourReality): Despite the overwhelming evidence, she still refuses to believe that the Teltin facility's sole cause was to make her into what she is, and that she didn't survive solely because she was stronger than the rest.

[It's All About Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllAboutMe): Not that she doesn't have a long list of reasons to feel this way, but regardless. If brought to Horizon and hearing about Husks, Jack will comment that it's *almost* as bad as what Cerberus did to her.

[I "Uh" You, Too](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IUhYouToo): Despite being in love with Shepard if romanced, she never *says* she is.
QUOTE  **Jack**: [Don't get killed, dumbass. When this is over, I'm getting laid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tsundere). 
**Shepard**: [I love you too.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker)
[Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass): Pre-[Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment), and she knows it.

[Jerkass Has a Point](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkassHasAPoint): Her suspicions about Cerberus eventually betraying her and Shepard are [proven correct in the end](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProperlyParanoid). By *3*, the Illusive Man is revealed to have been manipulating Shepard to serve his own purposes the whole time.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): In *3*.

[Karma Houdini](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KarmaHoudini): She's a mass murderer guilty of piracy, theft of a military craft, destruction of a space station, and vandalism  (SPOILER)  but if she survives to game 3 she suffers no mentioned legal troubles and in fact has been hired to teach biotic students at Grissom Academy. May also count as [Earn Your Happy Ending](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EarnYourHappyEnding), seeing as she had to take part in a galaxy-saving operation to earn enough respect from Hackett to get said posting. When trying and failing to recruit Kasumi again, Shepard says they can use their Spectre status to get her a pardon, so they probably did something similar for Jack.

[Kick the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickTheDog): A favorite past-time of hers pre [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment), including but not limited to mass murder, [destroying a moon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColonyDrop), being a [Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass), and being such a [Troll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll) that she's been banned from the extranet (among other places) several times. And most of this behavior is done [For the Evulz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForTheEvulz).
[Lack of Empathy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LackOfEmpathy): Initially. She gets better.
[The Lad-ette](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLadette): Her behavior isn't even remotely feminine.
[Lady Swears-a-Lot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadySwearsALot): In ME3, Joker asks if she has a swear jar, because emptying it would buy another cruiser.
[Last Girl Wins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastGirlWins): MaleShep meets her last out of the women who give the Paramour achievement.

[Last-Second Word Swap](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastSecondWordSwap): At the end of the Grissom Academy mission.
QUOTE  **Jack**: Screw you, f—flight lieutenant. 
**Joker:** Uhh, what the hell was that?

[Lean and Mean](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeanAndMean): For such a small woman, Jack is very strong and cruel to others. This changes after her [Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn)...[somewhat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrillSergeantNasty).

[Loners Are Freaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonersAreFreaks): Likes to be alone in an isolated part under the ship. Shepard has the option to visit her though and can convince her to bond with others. By *3*, she does.

[Lovable Sex Maniac](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LovableSexManiac): In the Citadel DLC if you romance her. If you dance with her, she asks you to not tire yourself out because *"We're gonna be doing it on the table later"*. <sup>note </sup>  **Cortez:** HEY! Some of us *eat* at that table! **Jack:** Buddy, you got *that* right!  The morning after she says she's horny, but contemplate that other people are already awake. She also makes several comments on Miranda's figure.
QUOTE  **Jack**: You as turned on as I am right now? 
**Shepard**: (Confused) You want to have sex in the combat simulator? 
**Jack**: (Mischievously) No...I wanna make love.
[Love Is a Weakness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveIsAWeakness): Initially believes in this, but Paragon Shepard can convince her otherwise if romanced.
[Love Redeems](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveRedeems): The Paragon ending to her romance.

[Male Gaze](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaleGaze): Although not as much as [Miranda](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice), she still has it. When Shepard asks about her tattoos, the camera pans all over across her torso, with a close-up shot of her breasts. She even assumes Male Shepard is checking her out.

[Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear): You know that she's an ax crazy killer, right? By *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)* she reserves that behavior for anyone who shows hostility towards her students at Grissom Academy. When the subject of her students fighting on the front lines is brought up, she'll show distress and non-verbally beg Shepard not to agree with Sanders' assessment; if Shepard says the students are best used for support (the safer option), Jack will brighten and cheerfully tell her students they go where they're assigned.

[Masculine Girl, Feminine Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasculineGirlFeminineBoy): Her relationship with Male Paragon Shepard, especially if romanced. She's the tough-as-nails, murderous criminal while he's the [All-Loving Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllLovingHero).

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Presumably inspired by [Jack London](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/JackLondon), who's famously quoted from *Call of the Wild*: "Kill or be killed, eat or be eaten, was the law; and this mandate, down out of the depths of Time, he obeyed." Also like London, Jack became quite the traveler.
[Megaton Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MegatonPunch): She's fond of using biotics to create these.

[Mildly Military](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MildlyMilitary): From the sound of things, she has some manner of provisional officer's rank in the Alliance Navy, judging from banter with Joker, and the fact that she's administrating her students' operations once they go into the field. Although it's given her purpose, she's still Jack, as most readily evidenced by her choice of attire. Shepard will comment that military life suits her, because it gives her everything she wants: room, board, three square meals, targets to attack — [and people she can count on](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FamilyOfChoice).
[Mind over Matter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MindOverMatter): Considered to be the one of the most powerful human biotic.

[Mini-Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MiniBoss): If you don't do the Grissom Academy mission before a set time, or not at all,  (SPOILER) she gets indoctrinated and works for Cerberus, becoming a mini-boss in the Cerberus HQ .

[Missing Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingChild): How did Cerberus get Jack as the primary test subject? It turns out that Jack's mother was approached by an agent posing as her doctor, informing her that Jack was dying of a dangerous illness and they needed to take her baby away for diagnostics. Her mother trusted the agent and handed over her child, never to see her again. With Jack's parents unaware of their child's current status, she was nonexistent to the entire world and Cerberus was free to subject her to [inhumane tests](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColdBloodedTorture).

[Morality Chain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityChain): Paragon Shepard becomes this to her. Acknowledged in *3* when she notes that some of Shepard's speeches rubbed off on her. Even she seems a little surprised by this. It works both ways — even a Paragon Shepard will respond to her "You as turned on as I am right now?" at the Armax Combat Simulator with a "Hell yes!" and [Big Damn Kiss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigDamnKiss).

[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): Somehow to a *lesser* extent than Miranda, despite showing many times as much skin as her probably due to Miranda being considerably better endowed than Jack). For starters, Jack doesn't wear a shirt in her default appearance (just a harness), exposing most of her chest and upper body.
    - It gets revealed in 3 that the harness was actually an attempt to avert this by compressing her bust to make it appear *less* impressive than it actually is. [Why she didn't take the next logical step and wear an actual shirt on top of it is anyone's guess.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FridgeLogic) (Answer: Show off the tattoos.) - In 3, she's more sexualized than Miranda is. Her pants are cut so that she's constantly showing off her bare hips, her harness bears tons of cleavage and if she's romanced she will just ooze sex with almost every word. Her dancing during the Citadel DLC only adds to it.

[Murder Is the Best Solution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MurderIsTheBestSolution): As should be obvious by this point.
QUOTE  **Shepard:** What is it about killing that fascinates you so much? 
**Jack:** I figure every time someone dies and it's not me, my chances of survival go up. Simple.
[My Eyes Are Up Here](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyEyesAreUpHere): When Male Shepard talks with her frequently, she assumes that he's checking her out and wants to use her for sex.
[My Hero, Zero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyHeroZero): She's a hero called Subject Zero. But, [don't call her that nickname.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton)

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag):
    - She sometimes screams **I WILL DESTROY YOU!** in the same way the human biotic mooks did in *[Mass Effect](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect1)*. - Mocked by Rodriguez in ME3 QUOTE **Rodriguez**: I will destroy you! **Jack**: [Drink your juice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastFromCalories), Rodriguez. You couldn't destroy wet tissue paper.

tropeName: Names to Run Away from Really Fast
tropeNotes: [Names to Run Away from Really Fast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamesToRunAwayFromReallyFast): Inverted. Also, it would be too late for you to run anyway.
[The Nicknamer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheNicknamer): Refers to Miranda as "the Cheerleader" and Paragon Shepard as "King of the Boy Scouts" or "Queen of the Girl Scouts" depending on their gender.

[Noodle Incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident): While it doesn't get nearly as much attention due to being brought up in the same conversation as the "[vandalism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColonyDrop) incident," all she says about stealing a military craft is, "Shouldn't have left the thing unlocked. Besides, parades are boring. I helped."

[Not So Above It All](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoAboveItAll): The most notorious, dangerous human criminal in the galaxy likes to write poetry and [troll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll) people on the internet.

[Odd Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddFriendship): Particularly with a Paragon Shepard, who she sarcastically refers to as "King/Queen of the Boy/Girl Scouts" in the third game. Nonetheless, it's clear that Jack owes a lot of her character development to Shepard's influence and she admits that all their [speeches](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PatrickStewartSpeech) clearly rubbed off on her.
    - [Odd Couple](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddCouple): Her romance with [Paragon Shepard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncorruptiblePurePureness) is one of the oddest in the entire series.

[Only Known by Their Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyKnownByTheirNickname): Jack is never called by her real name, chiefly because it was kept a secret by the Teltin project. Liara reveals she knows her real name, and divulges her first name, Jennifer.

tropeName: The Only One Allowed to Defeat You
tropeNotes: [The Only One Allowed to Defeat You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheOnlyOneAllowedToDefeatYou): Judging by the confrontation between them, she seems to think this way about Miranda; she says she'll keep Miranda alive so she can tear her apart herself after the mission.  (SPOILER)  Fortunately, she buries the hatchet with her later .

[Oppose What You Suffered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OpposeWhatYouSuffered): Previous to *[Mass Effect 2](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect2)*, Jack was both a captive and a test subject of Cerberus when she was a child. (SPOILER)  If she survives the [Suicide Mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuicideMission)  Jack later becomes the [Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear) (if [Tough Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ToughLove)-practising) teacher of a group of young biotics  (SPOILER) in *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)*, when Cerberus comes back and attempts to abduct them in order to turn them into biotic assassins .
[Person of Mass Destruction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PersonOfMassDestruction): [And she revels in it.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy)

[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog): Jack does have a few nice moments of kindness in the series.
    - During her loyalty mission, Shepard can convince her to spare Aresh's life instead of killing him. - In Grissom Academy, she saves the life of Rodriguez, the student she picks on the most, (SPOILER) from Cerberus troops . - In the *Citadel DLC*, she adopts an abandoned varren to keep as a pet. - Her whole romance can be seen as this towards Paragon Shepard, since she was initially hostile towards him, but gave him a chance after [he was so kind to her](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefrostingIceQueen) when [he had every reason not to be](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SingleWomanSeeksGoodMan).

[Physical Scars, Psychological Scars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhysicalScarsPsychologicalScars): Jack's surgical scars from Tetlin are another reminder of her horrific time there. This also left her with some issues  (SPOILER)  which she can work past, how much she progress varies depending on dialogue and story choices .

[Power of Trust](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerOfTrust): Jack's inability to trust *anyone* has made her the [Social Darwinist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SocialDarwinist). She was thrown off by someone who sacrificed themselves so she could live. It isn't until she's in a situation (Grissom Academy) where she can wholeheartedly trust other people (her students, Kahlee Sanders) that she begins her true [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment).

[Power Perversion Potential](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerPerversionPotential): Biotic powers can be unstable during the act, but can also have "benefits." [Mordin, as always, is the man to see.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f6RayAQfMqY)

[Raised in a Lab](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RaisedInALab): broke out one day in her teenage years and spent most of her adult life tearing around Citadel space, since the lab taught her how to control her phenomenal Biotic abilities and not much else. Including social norms. She's rude, crude, runs around topless, and once rammed a space station into a moon for giggles.

[Rape as Backstory](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapeAsBackstory): It says something about her past when the multiple times she's been sexually assaulted count as some of her **least** traumatic memories.
    - If the player remains romantically interested in Jack, she'll openly kiss him in front of everyone, even her students, no longer afraid to show open affection.
[Red Oni, Blue Oni](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedOniBlueOni): The red to Miranda's blue.

[Retired Monster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredMonster): Though she ultimately becomes a genuinely good person, she also never regrets any of her past misdeeds, including murdering dozens of people with little justification and crashing a space station into a moon.
[Reforged into a Minion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReforgedIntoAMinion): If you skip Grissom Academy, she's captured  (SPOILER) and turned into a Cerberus Phantom .

[The Reveal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReveal): If you completed the "Lair of the Shadow Broker" DLC in *2*, taking Liara along to  (SPOILER)  Grissom Academy  in *3* reveals that Jack's birth-name is actually  (SPOILER)  Jennifer , though Liara hasn't been able to discover her surname yet.

[Revenge Before Reason](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RevengeBeforeReason): On her loyalty mission, Shepard has the option to point out that Jack's quest for vengeance is tearing her apart, making her more unstable than before. Jack eventually realizes this, [and intends to control herself more often.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment)

[Revenge by Proxy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RevengeByProxy): A variation. Jack snipes at Miranda a lot, (leading to quite a bit of animosity between them) likely because Miranda (being a Cerberus agent) is the easiest and most convenient outlet for her rage, even though Miranda wasn't even *with* Cerberus when they tortured Jack for years. She also takes issue with Miranda's "cheerleading" and excuses for the things Cerberus has done, including Pragia.

[The Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRival): To Miranda, complete with an [The Only One Allowed to Defeat You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheOnlyOneAllowedToDefeatYou) mentality. This reaches its peak in during a catfight that Shepard has to head off, possibly also losing the loyalty of one or the other.  (SPOILER)  Fortunately, as of the Citadel DLC, they've smoothed things over a bit .

[Roaring Rampage of Revenge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoaringRampageOfRevenge): Apparently a recurring event for her. You add her to the crew right after she finishes one of these. And you get her loyalty by blowing up the facility that made her who she is.

[Samus Is a Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SamusIsAGirl): Everyone you talk to on the way to Jack's cell refers to her either in the third person or gender neutral pronouns (and in utter fear). And then you see this apparently small young woman break out of metal restraints and wipe out three heavy mechs with nothing but her biotics.
QUOTE **Grunt:** *That's* Jack? Jack is tiny. *[Jack starts wrecking the place]* Let's get down there, I wanna see!

QUOTE **Legion:** Jack is smaller than her reputation suggests. *[Jack starts wrecking the place]* Situation chaotic. Decisive action required.

[Satisfied Street Rat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SatisfiedStreetRat): Although she's hardly "satisfied" unless she's in a fight. Not only that, but she *is* extremely pissed off at Cerberus for using her as a lab rat; while Shep can say "You enjoy the power they gave you," she's damn sore that "they didn't give (her) a choice".

[Sex Equals Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SexEqualsLove):
    - Averted. Kelly mentions that Jack pushes people away, but approaches sex casually, and warns that having a one-night stand with her is a bad idea. Having sex with Jack is an option fairly early into the game. If the casual sex option is chosen, she's really into it, but says that she doesn't want to play if you try and talk to her again. If you refuse sex with her and show interest in her as a person, she'll eventually come out of her shell and begin to actually love Shepard. - During the final love scene between Jack and Shepard in *2*, they don't have sex. Rather, Jack snuggles with Shepard contently. Considering her [Rape as Backstory](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapeAsBackstory), she probably needs affection more than sex.

["Shut Up" Kiss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShutUpKiss): On the receiving end if Shepard romanced her when the Grissom Academy mission finishes.  (SPOILER) Shep grabs and kisses her before she gives too many details about her "N7 Tattoo" .

[Single Woman Seeks Good Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SingleWomanSeeksGoodMan): She may be the [Trope Codifier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TropeCodifier) for this. If [Paragon Shepard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncorruptiblePurePureness) drops hints of romantic interest in her, then Jack will develop a serious crush on him. Although Jack does admire Renegade Shepard, she ends up falling in love with Paragon Shepard because of his kindness and real love for her.  (SPOILER)  She even gets an N7 tattoo to remember him.

[Slap-Slap-Kiss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlapSlapKiss): If romanced in *2*, the first thing she does to Shepard in *3* is deck him.  <sup>note </sup>   For leaving and turning himself in to the Alliance after the events of the second game.  Then give him a passionate kiss.
[Slasher Smile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlasherSmile): She [enjoys](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight) fighting a lot.
[Sociopathic Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SociopathicHero): "Heroic" is very much a stretch for her.  (SPOILER) At first .
[So Proud of You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoProudOfYou): Some cut content from 3's endgame includes her [reassuring her squad](https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=k_AK6vz4_bM).

[Statuesque Stunner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatuesqueStunner): According to her mugshot which can be [briefly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreezeFrameBonus) seen in *Lair of the Shadow Broker*, Jack is roughly six feet tall <sup>note </sup>  but so are nearly all the humanoid character, even those sources state otherwise, due to game limitations; Jack is being noted because she is given corroboration for her height . She is also noted to be very attractive by multiple characters.

[Stealth Pun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StealthPun): She once used "Jacqueline Nought" as an alias, with "nought" being the British term for the American "zero." So she is "Jack Zero".  (SPOILER) If she died in *2*, this is her listed name on the *Normandy* cenotaph .
[Stern Teacher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SternTeacher): She's tough on her students and receives their adoration in return. A bit crazier than most examples though.

[Stripperiffic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperiffic): Her first costume is essentially a strap across her breasts and a pair of pants; her alternate costume is a bit more modest. In *[Citadel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent)* she explains that it was a deliberate attempt to make her breasts look as small as possible, since [showing off her rack in a prison ship would have been a bad idea.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrisonRape) Though it must be pointed out that compressing your breasts with a harness is a fine idea if you're trying to look less sexually appealing, wearing *only* the harness defeats the purpose.
    - The third DLC outfit makes her a [Badass Biker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBiker) with a leather jacket, pants and shades, so everything is hidden, including tattoos. - Her outfit in *3* is more conservative, but it still shows quite a lot of skin.
[Super-Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier): Cerberus wanted to make her a powerful biotic warrior... [and they succeeded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoneHorriblyRight).

[Survivor Guilt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SurvivorGuilt): One of the reasons she pushes everyone away is that (SPOILER) the last person who cared about her ended up dying in order to save her instead of betraying her as she'd expected he would. This made her even more violent and reclusive .
    - (SPOILER) In *3*, if you chose to send her students to the front lines and romanced her, by the end, they'll all be dead as shall Shepard (in most endings). After all her major character development, everyone closest to her still dies .
[Tattoo as Character Type](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TattooAsCharacterType): They're a way to reassert control over her body and remind her of the colorful life she's led since since escaping Pragia.

[Tattooed Crook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TattooedCrook): [The art book shows just how much detail and thought went into them,](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual) including tally marks for people she’s killed, including a skeleton tattoo with *marks over each bone she killed a person by breaking.* Needless to say, [she's got a lot of tally marks.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy)
[Teeth-Clenched Teamwork](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeethClenchedTeamwork): With *everyone* in *2*, but especially Miranda.

[ Therapy Is for the Weak](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TherapyIsForTheWeak): The reason she doesn't take much exception to Renegade Shepard's lack of sympathy for her backstory, seeing herself less as someone who *really* needs some therapy, and more someone who just needs to be told to suck it up and stop whining. That, and she thinks Renegade Shepard's attitude is funny.
[There Was a Door](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThereWasADoor): Justified: After being released from cryo, she has to escape somehow, and the quickest way is to break through walls with her biotics.
[This Is for Emphasis, Bitch!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisIsForEmphasisBitch): Quite a few of her battle cries. She's fond of the B-word in conversation as well.
[Token Evil Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenEvilTeammate): Even after recruitment, she remains a barely contained ball of homicidal rage. She can grow out of it eventually.
[Tomboyish Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomboyishName)  (SPOILER)  Though in the third game, Liara reveals that her real birth name is Jennifer .

[Tomboy with a Girly Streak](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomboyWithAGirlyStreak): She enjoys reading and writing poetry in her spare time. Her romance shows this off more though. As her interest grows in Paragon Shepard, her voice changes from rough and masculine to a gentler, caring tone.
QUOTE (First conversation) 
**Shepard:** I should go. 
**Jack:** [Yep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker). 
(After dropping hints of romance) 
**Shepard:** I should go. 
**Jack:** Take care!
[Tomboyish Ponytail](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomboyishPonytail): Sports one in *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)*.
[Took a Level in Cheerfulness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInCheerfulness): She becomes much happier in *3* after her [Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn).

[Took a Level in Kindness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInKindness): A bit in *2*, much more if romanced. Quite a bit in *3*, where she's become  (SPOILER)  a full-fledged [Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear) and [Badass Teacher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassTeacher) who has left her [Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy) nature behind . The Citadel DLC takes it even further, showing her to now have a pet biotic varren named Eezo that she got from a rescue group who she is extremely affectionate towards (and the parallels to her own life she is [completely oblivious about](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComicallyMissingThePoint)).  (SPOILER)  She also no longer wants to kill Miranda .

[Trailers Always Spoil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrailersAlwaysSpoil): Within the game, all you're told is that you're picking up a dangerous biotic named Jack; it's left as a surprise that she's a female until you see her the first time. The surprise is completely ruined by the fact that the character was introduced in promotional material prior to the game's release, including a personal character trailer. Although her name is only given as "Subject Zero" in this material, enough detail is given about how she's recruited that the only way her sex can come as a surprise is if the player goes into the game completely blind.

[Transhuman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Transhuman): Possibly one of the most powerful human biotic yet. To wit, her power level is equal to *an asari matriarch* whose been through [Training from Hell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrainingFromHell) to become [The Dreaded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDreaded) [Knight Errant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightErrant).

[Trauma Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TraumaButton): Cerberus in general. But surrendering to them again is an even bigger one. Going for the Renegade response when they try to "persuade" the Grissom Academy students to give in has Jack *snarl* at Rodriguez to take a good, long look at her Cerberus-inflicted surgical scars.

[Troll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll): She was banned from the Citadel News Net forums for excessive and repeated swearing, derogatory comments, inflammatory comments, and circumventing work-safe filters. She lasted 15 minutes in an online poker community before being banned for the same reasons.
    - She also gets vanned a lot. You are actually supposed to get her out of the proverbial space van in her recruit mission.
[Tsundere](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tsundere): If Shepard coaxes her out of her hostility and helps her find some personal closure, she displays a softer and more vulnerable side.

[Tyke-Bomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tykebomb): The Shadow Broker's dossier indicates  (SPOILER) she was actually taken by Cerberus shortly after birth. Her mother was convinced the child had died from horrible element zero-induced seizures .
[The Unfettered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheUnfettered):  (SPOILER)  Gets better in *3* .
[Unflinching Walk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnflinchingWalk): [The Big Damn Kiss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigDamnKiss) with a romanced Shepard as a mech explodes during the Citadel DLC.

[Ungrateful Bitch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UngratefulBitch): In her recruitment mission, Shepard not only frees her, but saves her by shooting a Blue Suns trooper just before he shot Jack. Her response is to loudly insult Shepard.
QUOTE  **Shepard:** This ship's going down in flames. I've got the only way out. I'm offering to take you with me. *And you're arguing.*
[Unreliable Narrator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnreliableNarrator):  (SPOILER) She wasn't in the best position to figure out just what was going on in the Teltin facility .

[Unskilled, but Strong](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnskilledButStrong): She is skilled in throwing out various biotic techniques, but is one of the few squadmates in the series to lack formal military or paramilitary training of any kind (outside of the experimentation and abuse she endured as a child) meaning she can get quite easily taken down if outmaneuvered by enemies, [both in and out of gameplay](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStoryIntegration). Her very first scene showcases this quite well: she tears through three YMIR Mechs with one super-charged-up biotic blast at the beginning of the mission, but near the end drops her guard and would have been killed by a surprise attack from a single [mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mook) if not for a quick [Stab the Scorpion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StabTheScorpion) moment on Shepard's part.
[Vitriolic Best Buds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VitriolicBestBuds):  (SPOILER)  With Miranda in the Citadel DLC, for given value of "best buds" .

[Wall Bang Her](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WallBangHer): Kasumi will advise a Renegade Shepard who had sex with Jack:
QUOTE **Kasumi:** You might want to dial down Jack's biotic implants before you hook up with her again. I doubt Cerberus could afford to build another *Normandy*.

[We Can Rule Together](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeCanRuleTogether): In her first conversation with Shepard, she suggests the two of them team up to take over the *Normandy* and pirate other ships in order to conquer the universe as partners in crime.

[What Beautiful Eyes!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatBeautifulEyes): Her big brown eyes with their expertly groomed lashes are *gorgeous*, even more so due to how wild and feral the rest of her body looks. They're easily her most striking feature during dialogue cutscenes despite of her many tattoos and her behaviour. The only other character in the whole game that can hold a candle to her in that department is Samara.

tropeName: What Is This Thing You Call "Love"?
tropeNotes: [What Is This Thing You Call "Love"?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatIsThisThingYouCallLove): Downplayed, but still present. Jack doesn't understand what real love actually is, only understanding that people have sex to get what they want. She questions why a romancing Shepard doesn't just do it with her and is confused when he wants to bond with her. She eventually realizes her true feelings for him if Shepard remains faithful to pursuing a true romance with her.

[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): In the third game, she punches Shepard in the face, saying that  (SPOILER) Shepard should never have trusted Cerberus . If you romanced her, it turns into [Anger Born of Worry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngerBornOfWorry), as she punches  (SPOILER) Shepard for turning themself in after the events of Arrival .

[What Would X Do?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatWouldXDo): If she survives the second game and you make it to Grissom Academy in time in the third, you'll find her teaching a batch of young biotics and defending them from Cerberus. She even admits that some of Shepard's leadership rubbed off on her, what with "all those damn speeches."

[When She Smiles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenSheSmiles): If romanced successfully by Paragon Shepard, she finally shows *real* happiness. Not a [Slasher Smile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlasherSmile), but a genuine smile. She also smiles when taking about her students before she scowls [Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear) style that if anyone tries to screw with them...

[Woobie, Destroyer of Worlds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WoobieDestroyerOfWorlds): Because seriously — after a life of physical torture, emotional, and sexual abuse, Jack really deserves a little bit of happiness. And a Shepard hug.

tropeName: You Are Better Than You Think You Are
tropeNotes: [You Are Better Than You Think You Are](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreBetterThanYouThinkYouAre): How Paragon Shepard prompts her [Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn).
[You Need to Get Laid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouNeedToGetLaid): Inverted; see [Sex Equals Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SexEqualsLove) above.
[Your Makeup Is Running](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YourMakeupIsRunning): During her romance scene.

[Action Genre Hero Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGenreHeroGuy): He has the harsh-sounding monosyllabic name, the orphan background (even if he doesn't care about Okeer and finds a [Parental Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalSubstitute) in both Shepard and Wrex) and the no-nonsense personality, and judging from the way his unfused head plates extend to his chin they're the Krogan equivalent of a buzzcut.

[Alcohol-Induced Idiocy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlcoholInducedIdiocy): During the *Citadel DLC* for *3*, Grunt decides to celebrate his "birthday" by having a wild night out on the Citadel. Much [property damage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingDisasterArea) and [hilarity ensues](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HilarityEnsues).

[Appropriated Appellation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AppropriatedAppellation): He took the name "Grunt" from one of Okeer's last words. It's noted that there were some more impressive words to use as a name, but he liked "grunt" for its simplicity (and because it has no greater meaning).

[Asskicking Leads to Leadership](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AsskickingLeadsToLeadership): How Grunt asserts his command of Aralakh Company (essentially a collection of the best warriors from every krogan clan on Tuchanka) in *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)*.

[Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy): Subverted. [As prone to violence as he is,](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight) Grunt makes a point of saying [that he requires meaning in his life,](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesperatelyLookingForAPurposeInLife) and seeks to challenge and fight strong enemies. It's the fighting and glory he's after, not the death.

[Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast):
    - "I don't need luck. I have ammo." - During his [Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand): "*My* turn, heh heh heh."

[Badass Bookworm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBookworm): The Shadow Broker dossier reveals that Grunt has taken a liking to the works of Ernest Hemingway, with the sole exception of *[A Farewell to Arms](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/AFarewellToArms)* (See [Genius Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GeniusBruiser) entry.)
[Become a Real Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BecomeARealBoy): The goal to secure his loyalty.
[Beehive Barrier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeehiveBarrier): His Fortification power.

[Big Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigEater): Overlaps with [Extreme Omnivore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExtremeOmnivore). In the *Citadel* DLC for *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)*, [some people try to coax their way in to Shepard's party with offers of food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FoodAsBribe):
QUOTE "Fishdog Food Shack Delivery? Sure... wait a minute. Nice try! No."<br data-format="\\"/>"Yes, I like pie, and no, you can't come in."<br data-format="\\"/>"You're selling cookies? Uh... well... no, I shouldn't let you in. Damn."

[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): Even more so than normal for a krogan. Given the conditions on Tuchanka, with children and women deliberately separated from the fighting males, it's likely that he's had more exposure to the krogan warrior culture than usual for a krogan his developmental age.
[The Berserker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBerserker): Eventually matures into a relatively stable (by [krogan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProudWarriorRaceGuy) standards) blood knight.

[The Big Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigGuy): Personality of a Class IV with [the intelligence of a Class V.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GeniusBruiser) Definitely one of the strongest combat specialists. [Just a wee bit unpredictable.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FoeTossingCharge)

[Big Guy Fatality Syndrome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGuyFatalitySyndrome): His mission in *3* is a perfect example of this, down to him saying "I'll hold them off,"  (SPOILER)  but it's subverted if you completed his Rite of Passage .
[Boisterous Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoisterousBruiser): Any time there's a fight in the offing, Grunt will be all but jumping up and down with glee.

[Born as an Adult](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BornAsAnAdult): Or a teenager, anyway — he's designed to look younger than other krogan (e.g, his head-crest hasn't merged into a single plate yet, and his skin is lighter-colored than other krogan).

[Bring It](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BringIt): Standard for a Krogan, but highlighted during his [Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand) with the rachni.
QUOTE **Grunt:** *My* turn. Heh heh heh.

[Brutal Honesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalHonesty): One of the most blunt and forward squad members, which can often be a source of unintentional comedy. For example, here's his reaction when stepping onto Tuchanka for the first time: QUOTE **Grunt:** This is the great krogan homeworld? This is the land of the Kregak, Shiagur, and Veeoll? This chunk of rock is barely even worth standing on! Never thought I'd miss the tank...
    - If Morinth tries to hit him up:
QUOTE **Grunt**: Go away, asari slut.

[Buffy Speak](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BuffySpeak):
    - When he talks, if it's not [Sesquipedalian Loquaciousness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SesquipedalianLoquaciousness), it's this. QUOTE **Grunt:** See, now we're having fun! Me remembering good deaths and you, with your... funny human thing. - On getting into cover: QUOTE **Grunt:** We should hide behind... stuff.

[Can't Hold His Liquor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CantHoldHisLiquor): If Shepard throws a wild party in the *Citadel* [DLC](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent), Grunt ends up passed out on the floor of their shower before the night is half over.

[Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment): A terrible choice to act as a fireteam leader in his debut appearance, by *3* he has becomes a highly capable combat leader who (though rough) very much cares for the lives of the krogan under his command. While it is possible for them almost all to die, it's due to circumstances out of his control.
[Child Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildSoldier): By krogan standards, but he revels in it.

[The Chosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChosenOne): Okeer created him to be a perfect krogan. Grunt eventually gets the mindset as well. The Urdnot Shaman seems to think this too, sending an email to Shepard demanding that they not get themself and Grunt killed.
[Clone Angst](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CloneAngst): Somewhat. He stops angsting about it once he's accepted by other krogan.

[Clones Are People, Too](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClonesArePeopleToo): Some of the less sympathetic krogan view him as an abomination, but others, such as Wrex and the Urdnot shaman, see him only as a fine specimen of a krogan, tank-bred or not.
[Coming of Age Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComingOfAgeStory): His loyalty mission.
[Defeat Means Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatMeansFriendship): He tries to kill Shepard until they demonstrate their worthiness to command him.

[Does Not Like Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoesNotLikeSpam): Doesn't like ramen, apparently, though he will eat almost damn near anything else—see below, though his objection is mostly based on its appearance rather than its taste. By *3*, particularly in the *Citadel* DLC, he seems to have acquired a taste for it as well.
QUOTE  **Grunt**: This what passes for food out here? My tastes run more along the lines of "edible". Looks like worms. Dead ones. This a Human thing? Ugh. I'll pass. I'll eat almost anything, but I stress 'almost'.
[Do Not Go Gentle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoNotGoGentle): If he dies in *3*, he's going out the way Krogan were meant to: in combat. He'll rack up a serious body count in the process too.

[Enemies Equals Greatness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnemiesEqualsGreatness): This is why he follows Shepard so loyally. Anyone who has made the [kind of enemies](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination) that Shepard has made has earned his respect.
QUOTE **Grunt:** This is why I follow you Shepard. BIG THINGS!

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): Bursting out of his tank, pinning Shepard to the wall and demanding that he be given a purpose. Then giving a small laugh of amusement when Shepard either reveals they've been holding a gun to Grunt's stomach all this time or actually shoots Grunt in the armor a few times to get him to back off.

[Evil Laugh](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilLaugh): When things are about to get/already are violent, he has this low-pitched slow "Heh heh heh" laugh, as if he is giddy with anticipation in his own little way at the prospect of a fight.
[Extreme Omnivore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExtremeOmnivore): Gets hungry at certain scenes of violence, to the disgust of his teammates. In *Citadel* he even ate a lamp while drunk.

["Facing the Bullets" One-Liner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacingTheBulletsOneLiner): In *3*, when faced with hundreds of rachni husks, he quips "Heh... my turn."  (SPOILER) Subverted if he was loyal in *2*, in which case he comes out covered in their blood and none the worse for wear.

[Fantastic Racism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasticRacism): He hates turians, thanks to the tank's images. However, as he can explain to Shepard, this doesn't apply to Garrus, since he's part of Shepard's "clan".

[Father to His Men](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FatherToHisMen): In *3*, to Arlakh Company. If Shepard frees the Rachni Queen, Grunt will be visibly upset and growling "Damn you, Shepard!" because it'll certainly mean the death of his men to [Hold the Line](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HoldTheLine). Despite being a [Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight), his people aren't *expendable*.

[Foe-Tossing Charge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FoeTossingCharge): In the 3rd game, while his squad is pinned down, you get to watch him charge a Ravager, *pick it up* and *throw it off a cliff*.
    - A short time later, he does it to cover Shepard's escape, killing half a dozen Ravagers in *seconds* before tackling one off a cliff. And if you have his loyalty? He *survives* it. - Does this in his introduction, charging into Shepard full force and violently elbowing them into the wall by the neck. If it had been any human other than [Shepard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier), they most certainly would have died.

[Gameplay and Story Integration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStoryIntegration): He's the only party member in *2* that uses Armor instead of Shields or Barriers for protection. On Tali's recuitment mission, he's consequently uneffected by the sunlight's shield-and-barrier-draining effect.

[Genius Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GeniusBruiser): He had the military knowledge of several krogan warlords imprinted into him while he was being created. He's also a fan of [Sesquipedalian Loquaciousness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SesquipedalianLoquaciousness), [although he's rather young and doesn't always have the words he needs to describe things](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BuffySpeak).
    - And now, in *Lair of the Shadow Broker*, you find out he's reading (audiobook) [Hemingway!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/ErnestHemingway) He's finished *The Old Man and The Sea* and *[For Whom the Bell Tolls](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/ForWhomTheBellTolls)*, and is working on *[The Sun Also Rises](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/TheSunAlsoRises)*. Not a fan of *A Farewell To Arms* however. - He also apparently loves dinosaurs; he was apparently doing an extranet search on Urdnot Wrex, [when he encountered entries on Tyrannosaurus Rex - and that got him into looking into Earth dinosaurs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WikiWalk). *[The Old Man and the Sea](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/TheOldManAndTheSea)* apparently also got him interested in sharks. - He might possibly be an Otaku as he makes a *[Cowboy Bebop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/CowboyBebop)* reference while drunk in the shower and might be a fan of that anime. note  Also doubles as an [Actor Allusion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActorAllusion); Steve Blum also voiced Spike Spiegel. - He also possibly makes a Harry Potter reference and might be a fan of the book series as he asks "are you a wizard" also while he was drunk in the shower. He most likely read the Harry Potter book series on audiobook. - Note that his [spelling isn't perfect](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RougeAnglesOfSatin). Logical, though — he was educated in a tank, and the Earth books he read were *audiobooks*.
[Grievous Harm with a Body](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrievousHarmWithABody): Uses pieces of the Reaper-enhanced Rachni as weapons while buying time for Shepard and the Rachni Queen to escape in *3*.

[Hard Work Hardly Works](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HardWorkHardlyWorks): Every other teammate has gone through various forms of hell to be worthy of joining the team — Grunt is actually *born* in the *Normandy* SR-2's cargo bay ready to kick ass alongside them. He's actually kind of bothered by this, mourning his "thousand weaker brothers" who were sacrificed to make him an [Uberkrogan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ubermensch) and feeling like he hasn't earned his abilities.

[Healing Factor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingFactor): Grunt's passive skill gives him continuous regeneration. Fully upgraded and combined with his massive HP pool, this makes him exceptionally hard to kill even on Insanity.

[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): In the third game.  (SPOILER) He stays behind to fight off the indoctrinated rachni and [falls down a cliff after tackling one](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingYouWithMe). And, if he's loyal, he [actually manages](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope) to survive his sacrifice. As the team gets ready to head out to their next assignment, Grunt comes out, covered in rachni-husk blood, and asks a simple question. 
QUOTE  (SPOILER) **Grunt**:   (SPOILER) Anyone got... something to... [eat?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigEater)
[Hold the Line](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HoldTheLine): In *3*.  (SPOILER)  Whether he survives or not depends on if you completed his loyalty mission.

[Icy Blue Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IcyBlueEyes): One thing that differentiates Grunt from other Krogan are his brilliant blue eyes. It's not explained, whether it's just a part of Okeer's genetic engineering, or young Krogan have blue eyes (since other teen-equivalent Krogan have not been seen.)

tropeName: If You Ever Do Anything To Hurt Him
tropeNotes: [If You Ever Do Anything To Hurt Him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IfYouEverDoAnythingToHurtHim): After Grunt is inducted to Clan Urdnot, the Shaman sends Shepard a very stern email telling him to make sure Grunt survives, because he's very important to the shaman and Urdnot as a whole.

[Incendiary Exponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncendiaryExponent): Mentioned, though not seen, in the Citadel DLC. During his drunken night out on the Citadel, he mentions that riot foam didn't stop him because he was on fire due to stealing a burning C-Sec squad car.

[Incredibly Lame Pun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncrediblyLamePun): "Turians, I guess you have to work the blade. I don't see much point to it, though." [Beat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Beat) "Heh, much *point*... oh, never mind."

[In Love with Your Carnage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InLoveWithYourCarnage): He's very appreciative of Jack's escape from Purgatory if you take him with you, specifically the bodies she's leaving behind.
[The Knights Who Say "Squee!"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheKnightsWhoSaySquee): Thinks highly of both Shepard (especially Paragon Shepard)  (SPOILER) and Wrex .

[Laser-Guided Tyke-Bomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaserGuidedTykebomb): Okeer created him to lead the krogan against his personal enemies. However, his "programming" failed and Grunt could not care less about Okeer's goals.

[Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand): In *3*.  (SPOILER) Unlike Dagg who gets immediately overwhelmed, he managed to shrug off being stabbed by a Ravager and whacks it, and the rest, with a Ravager cannon that he ripped off from its corpse earlier and tackles another one at the edge of the cliff. If he's not loyal, this is how he dies... but if he is, he'll walk out under his own power.

[Late to the Punchline](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LateToThePunchline): Grunt finally starts giggling when he figures out some of his imprinted memories, like the image of a dead turian disfigured horribly (specifically, a krogan prying off the turian's face plates with a claw hammer). He thinks of it as hilarious because he "finally gets it": *[turians suck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasticRacism)*. When he tries to [explain why it's funny](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DontExplainTheJoke), Shepard is nonplussed.

[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): The most durable squadmate, and with the Claymore shotgun, he deals out a ton of damage. Even capable of doing the infamous krogan charge. And the charge? If he does it to another krogan, he'll **push them back**. This includes the considerably larger warlord on his loyalty mission. [Also, Scions.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FcJAo52a-qE)
[Lonely Piano Piece](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonelyPianoPiece): During his [Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand).

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName):
    - Despite choosing his name for the fact it *doesn't* have any greater meaning, Grunt endures a lot in order to prove himself worthy of the respect of other krogan, who look down on him for the manner of his birth. In that respect, he does indeed start out as a *Grunt*. - Eve mentions that the first noise a krogan makes becomes their name. Grunt is a kind of noise.
[Murder Is the Best Solution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MurderIsTheBestSolution): [Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight) standard procedure.

[Neural Implanting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeuralImplanting): The "imprints" he was given by Okeer when he was being grown in the tank. This is how he knows how to breathe, walk, talk, and kick ass. Unfortunately, the imprints were often without context.
QUOTE **Grunt:** Like holding a book for a child. Just "remember this," picture after picture. No help with finding a reason to care.

[Non-Standard Character Design](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonStandardCharacterDesign): His boulder-like forehead. No other krogan with a head structured like this is ever encountered in the entire franchise. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) offers a [doylist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WatsonianVsDoylist) explanation in that it's meant to resemble the unfused skull plates of a human baby, but no watsonian explanation has yet been offered in or out-of universe. Every krogan immediately calls him "young one" or "whelp", indicating that he's instantly recognized as a juvenile by other krogan.

tropeName: Not in This for Your Revolution
tropeNotes: [Not in This for Your Revolution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotInThisForYourRevolution): Unlike most of the team (the other exceptions being Zaeed, Kasumi, and Jack, who are all paid mercenaries), he couldn't care less about saving people from the Collectors. He just wants a good fight.

[One-Man Army](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneManArmy): Specifically designed by Okeer to be a krogan "lance" as opposed to their regular horde-based tactics.
    - If he's the only squadmate left to Hold the Line against the Collectors on the Suicide Mission, he can do so himself and come out alive. - His [Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice) in *3* has him going toe to toe with a small army of Reaper forces (including many [Ravagers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EliteMooks)) to buy Shepard's team time to shuttle the Rachni Queen to safety. (SPOILER) Assuming his loyalty was gained in the last game, he *survives* this stunt.

[Only Mostly Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyMostlyDead): In the third game, if you earned his loyalty.  (SPOILER) After said cliff-dive, he shows up just as the shuttle's about to leave, limping and covered in gallons of blood, but alive (and wondering if anyone has something to eat) .
[Optional Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalPartyMember): While his recruitment mission is mandatory, you don't actually have to release him from his tank.

[Parental Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalSubstitute):
    - Shepard, particularly Paragon Shepard, acts as one to him. Particularly in the *Citadel DLC* for *3*, where Shepard has to bail him out with C-Sec after his [wild night out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingDisasterArea) on the Citadel. QUOTE **Shepard**: Grunt, you apologise to the nice man for setting his car on fire.
    **Grunt**: Fine, I'm sorry for setting your car on fire...
    *[notices Shepard's look]*
    **Grunt**: ... and I won't do it again. note  Later, Shepard can tell Grunt, "You're my hero." - (SPOILER) Wrex also takes a shine to Grunt and adopts him into clan Urdnot, with an attitude of almost grooming Grunt to take over as the leader of clan Urdnot when he dies .
[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): He, like Jacob (and possibly Shepard) has regeneration-stopping Incendiary Ammo.

[Precocious Crush](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecociousCrush): Given his actual age and frequency to behave like a child, and some things he says about Liara in the *Citadel* DLC, he may have one of these on her.
[Proud Warrior Race Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProudWarriorRaceGuy): Eventually. Being accepted into the Urdnot clan really heals his tattered ego.

[Psychopathic Man Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychopathicManChild): Many of his mannerisms come across as rather child-like at times. He also plays with action figures on his spare time when he's not busy killing stuff, eating and reading Hemingway. Make sense since he's [less than a year old](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustifiedTrope). His actions in the Citadel DLC (and Paragon Shepard's response to them) also point in this direction.
[Punctuated!  For!  Emphasis!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunctuatedForEmphasis): **I. AM. KROGAN!**
[Really Was Born Yesterday](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReallyWasBornYesterday): As stated, you essentially witness his birth when you release him from his tank.

[Replacement Goldfish](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReplacementGoldfish): For his "father" Warlord Okeer, who was originally meant to be recruited on the Suicide Mission, but sacrificed himself to ensure Grunt's survival.

[Sealed Badass in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedBadassInACan): He's tank-bred, so he was actually created in the "can" rather than being initially sealed in it. When his tank is obtained, it's left up to the player when to open the can and let the badass out. He even plays the "neutral" part of the trope straight; he doesn't care much about morality, only asskicking.

[Shotguns Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShotgunsAreJustBetter): While he's good with rifles and will use them when necessary, he seems to prefer shotguns. In *2*, he's one of only two squadmates with a unique weapon: the Claymore heavy shotgun. In *3*, he can be seen wielding an Eviscerator throughout the Rachni Caves mission.
[Signature Laugh](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignatureLaugh): Grunt's low, drawling "Heh...heh...heh".
[Slasher Smile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlasherSmile): Accompanies the laugh.

[Sociopathic Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SociopathicHero): He couldn't care less about saving humanity. He just wants a good fight. And he laughs quite maniacally as he's tearing into your opponents. He gets better in *3*, particularly if Wrex is the Urdnot leader.
QUOTE  **Kelly Chambers:** I don't know what to feel about Grunt. My psych reports were for Okeer. We have no guarantees that Grunt is mentally stable. I get the feeling he just doesn't care about anything, including who lives or dies.

[Smarter Than You Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmarterThanYouLook): On top of being a krogan, a race not exactly known for its smarts, trailers made him seem quite basic in personality, but in fact he's conflicted, knowledgeable, and can talk with surprising eloquence on both these things and his frustration with the former. If he sounds less than intelligent, it's because big words have no "meaning" for him; that is, they're a waste of energy.

[Smug Super](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmugSuper): He was designed to be the *perfect* krogan and is very self-assured about this. Although, several conversations imply that [deep down](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathTheMask) he doesn't really see himself as such, leading him to overcompensate as a result.

[Stone Wall](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StoneWall): He can become this if you level him right; maxing out his [Fortification](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeehiveBarrier) power and giving him the Krogan Pureblood power can increase his health and defenses to the point where he will almost never die, but he won't do as much damage.

[Super-Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier): Grown in a vat to be the "perfect" krogan.
    - Part of his loyalty mission involves killing a [Thresher Maw](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SandWorm) on foot. Alliance handbooks tell you to take on a Maw with a few tanks and even then: expect losses. - His status as the "perfect" krogan likely contributed as to how he handled the Ravagers much better than Dagg, his replacement, did. (SPOILER) And managed to [No-Sell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSell) being stabbed in the back and fight through more of them.

[Super-Strength](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperStrength): Comes with being a krogan. [His genetically inferior "brother"](https://forums.spacebattles.com/threads/mass-effect-calcs-and-general-mass-effect-tech-discussion-and-number-crunching.315746/page-13#post-22394477) [manages to lift a metal sheet](https://media.giphy.com/media/xT8qBaH8bkOaTR64G4/giphy.gif)◊ massing nearly *four metric tons* before we meet him, for comparison. This comes up in gameplay as well, as Grunt is one of only three members of the team who can use weapons with arm-breaking levels of recoil, like the Claymore. The others are the cybernetically-enhanced Shepard and (SPOILER) the fully-artificial Legion.
[Sweet Tooth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SweetTooth): Grunt apparently has a special fondness for cookies, as well as pie.
[This Cannot Be!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisCannotBe): If taken to the plague-infested part of Omega (Mordin's recruitment mission): "*I do not get sick*!"

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): While he was always a terrifyingly effective fighter, his leadership skills improve massively between the second and third games. In the former, he's flagged as one of the poor choices for fireteam leader. In the latter, he ends up leading a multi-national squad of elite krogan soldiers, keeping them in line with a combination of good leadership and [Asskicking Leads to Leadership](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AsskickingLeadsToLeadership).

[Trailers Always Spoil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrailersAlwaysSpoil): The recruitment mission was clearly intended to make the player think they were getting Warlord Okeer as a squadmate. Getting Grunt instead was supposed to be a minor twist, but it was ruined by the pre-release trailer. Averted with Grunt's personality, however. Until the game was leaked, there was no indication that he was anything other than a typical krogan [Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight).
[Troll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll): Enjoys saying "no" to party crashers a little too much.
[Übermensch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ubermensch): He was created to be one, although he has little interest in it.

[Ultimate Life Form](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UltimateLifeForm):
    - Along with being the perfect warrior, this was what he was meant to be for the krogan species. - If you kill the Thresher Maw as part of his Loyalty quest he becomes one of two Krogans in a thousand years to kill a Maw on foot. The other was Wrex (though Grunt, unlike Wrex, didn't do it on his own). QUOTE **Grunt:** I am pure krogan. You should be in awe.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): Even before his mission, he seems to have nothing but respect for Shepard, his "Battlemaster". He even threatens Uvenk for spitting on Shepard's name. This is because [he loves to fight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight), and Shepard brings him along to fight ***"[BIG THINGS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AttackOfTheFiftyFootWhatever)"***. QUOTE **Grunt:** Shepard is my battlemaster. He/she has no match.
    - More pronounced with a Renegade Shepard. Grunt is clearly bristling at some of Shepard's commands, and *really* doesn't like it when Shepard speaks for him in front of Uvenk, even admitting Shepard's pissed him off more than once, but *still* says the above line. - Exemplified when Shepard commands he abandon Aralakh Company to help free the Rachni Queen. Despite being a [Father to His Men](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FatherToHisMen) and cursing Shepard, he still does it without a second thought.

[Unstoppable Rage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnstoppableRage): Constantly. Apparently this is the default state for his species. The Rite of Passage was devised simply to help teenage krogan get a handle on it — kind of like a young human's father taking him to a strip bar, except with guns and monsters. The sex comes afterward if a female is suitably impressed by the display. The Codex notes, however, that the rage only became so commonplace after the krogan devastated Tuchanka in nuclear war (before that, it was extremely rare and regarded as pathological). Admittedly, the Codex is an [in-universe resource](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnreliableNarrator).

[Warrior Poet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WarriorPoet):
    - According to the (SPOILER) Shadow Broker's dossier on him , he's become a fan of Hemingway. - Heck, even his dialogue from the beginning. His word choice is exquisite. This appears to be intentional on Okeer's part. Okeer similarly is surprisingly eloquent, even poetic, when speaking to Shepard upon their first meeting. It's entirely possible he programmed Grunt likewise.

[We Have Reserves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeHaveReserves): He was engineered by Okeer to be an aversion to this trope; were Okeer to cure the genophage, the krogan would go back to spawning like mad and covering the galaxy with their hordes. Okeer believes the true future of the krogan is to have superior, elite warriors rather than cannon fodder, hence why he made the [Super Prototype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperPrototype), Grunt, and threw away the thousands that did not meet his standards.

[What Would X Do?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatWouldXDo): In this case, 'X' being both Shepard and, if he survived the first game, Wrex. Grunt's development into a competent and [caring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AFatherToHisMen) (if rough due to krogan philosophy) combat leader by the time of *3* displays that he learned a lot from both of them and works to live up to their examples.

[Worthy Opponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponent): One of the first indications that he views Shepard as one is the little smirk he gives when he realizes Shepard had quietly pulled a gun and had it trained on Grunt the entire time Grunt had them pinned against the wall. QUOTE **Grunt:** Hah! Offer one hand, but arm the other. Wise, Shepard.
    - He comes to see the Collectors as this, stating that he "won't disrespect their strength by doing anything less than the worst to them." - In *3*, he notes that Okeer took pains to ensure he knew about and respected the rachni this way.

[Younger Than He Looks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YoungerThanHeLooks): He's [The Big Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigGuy) and a damned good one, but he's a [Designer Krogan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesignerBabies) grown in a [Krogan Jar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PeopleJars) and trained by [Neural Implanting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeuralImplanting). You don't recruit him so much as ["inherit"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KleptomaniacHero) his Krogan Jar. When you crack it open and start chatting, you're basically witnessing his *birth*. It's emphasized during the Citadel DLC when he behaves like a rowdy high school or college student during his "rampage", and is chastised like one by Shepard.

[You Shall Not Pass!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouShallNotPass): During his mission in *3* —  (SPOILER) whether you choose to save his team or the rachni, he has to escort you out of the caves and hold off a wave of Ravagers. He survives if you completed his loyalty mission.

tropeName: Absence Makes the Heart Go Yonder
tropeNotes: [Absence Makes the Heart Go Yonder](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbsenceMakesTheHeartGoYonder):  (SPOILER) He and Dr. Brynn Cole are together in *3* whether or not you romanced him .

[Anti-Advice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiAdvice): It's subtle, but almost every single recommendation that he makes in *2* where Shepard has a choice of what to do is the wrong thing. He advises going to get the Reaper IFF right away (before you've completed all recruitment and loyalty missions, which will result in people getting killed during the Suicide Mission), he recommends spacing Legion without turning it on (while you can't actually space Legion, reactivating him is optional  (SPOILER) but critical to brokering a peace between the Quarians and Geth ), and he volunteers himself to go through the pipes in the Collector base, which will get him killed. The only exception is asking him about upgrades; he correctly points out that the Normandy's current armor isn't going to cut it against the Collectors, and if you fail to heed his warning Jack will end up dead before you even fire a single bullet.
[Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero): Either a [Knight in Sour Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightInSourArmor) or [Pragmatic Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PragmaticHero).

[Ascended Meme](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedMeme): Jacob's ripped appearance during his romance scene with Shepard in *2* became something of an in-joke with the fandom. His files in the Shadow Broker DLC contained his insane workout routine and then by the Citadel DLC in *3*, he can get in a push-up competition with Vega, and then the morning after the party Shepard will wakeup to find Jack and Jacob engaged in a tense morning workout.
[The Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner): In *3* for his time with Cerberus.
