[Beware the Nice Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheNiceOnes): One of the most non-confrontational, baggage-deprived guys on your squad, but check out his loyalty mission's Renegade ending for what he's capable of when pushed.

[Black Dude Dies First](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackDudeDiesFirst): Potentially. He does volunteer for an assignment he's not geared towards, but it's possible to have already lost up to three people at that point. It really comes down to the player.
[Broken Pedestal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenPedestal): He respected his father once.  (SPOILER)  After his loyalty mission, *never again.*

[Brutal Honesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalHonesty): Similar to Ashley, Jacob is fairly direct with his opinions when asked. This will extend to *Shepard* as well.
QUOTE **The Illusive Man**: Jacob's never fully trusted me, but he's always been honest about it.
[Calling the Old Man Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CallingTheOldManOut):  (SPOILER) Was pretty pissed to find out what his father had been doing for the past 10 years .
[Canon Immigrant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonImmigrant): From *Mass Effect Galaxy*.

[Character Witness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterWitness): If he survives into *3*, he convinces Brynn Cole to trust Shepard. Without him, Shepard has a slightly harder time convincing her they're not with Cerberus and out to kill her people.

[Chick Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChickMagnet): He's had a past history with Miranda, Kasumi totally digs him, and he can possibly romance a Female Shepard. Continues into the third game,  (SPOILER)  where he has a new girlfriend regardless of whether he was with Shepard in the previous game or not .

[Crutch Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrutchCharacter): Jacob's ability layouts favor two specific niches; his incendiary ammo (which can be upgraded to Squad at max, giving the whole party access to it) helps to deal with Armored enemies, which are everywhere on Omega, and pull, which can be used to set up Biotic Explosions. Later in the game you get to recruit other characters (or unlock the powers yourself) reducing Jacob's utility.
[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): He has his moments, particularly in the Citadel DLC where he effortlessly trades banter with Shepard and ribs them quite a bit.

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): Went from being the main character of *Mass Effect Galaxy* to a party member in *[Mass Effect 2](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect2)* to an NPC in an optional mission in *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)*.
[Derailing Love Interests](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DerailingLoveInterests): In *3*, if you previously romanced him,  (SPOILER) he's already moved on to another woman he plans to settle down with .

tropeName: Desperately Looking for a Purpose in Life
tropeNotes: [Desperately Looking for a Purpose in Life](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesperatelyLookingForAPurposeInLife): Several characters in *2* peg him as being uncertain about what he really wants to do with his life. By the time of *3*, he's decided being with Cole is what he wants.

[Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator):  (SPOILER)  Early in his mission in *3*, Jacob gets shot in the stomach protecting some ex-Cerberus scientists. While he gets briefly treated, Jacob continues to power through the mission while injured .
QUOTE  **Shepard:** You should get that wound looked at.<br data-format="\\"/>**Jacob:** I'm good. I mean, I will.
[Disappeared Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad): For 10 years and counting...  (SPOILER) at least, until his loyalty mission .
[Dogged Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoggedNiceGuy): Inverted — female Shepard has to work to get him to open up to the possibility of a romance.

[Don't You Dare Pity Me!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DontYouDarePityMe): He doesn't want anyone thinking of him as a "baggage guy" or trying to "figure me out". You can actually convince him to break off the romance if you keep pushing him.
QUOTE **Jacob:** Even if you were right, how small would my problems be if you could 'fix' them with grad-school psych and a crying jag?

[Disappointed by the Motive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappointedByTheMotive): In his loyalty mission, Jacob isn't disappointed as he is *outraged* over the fact that his father spent 10 years on a remote planet, indulging in what he calls "a juvenile fantasy."
[Even the Guys Want Him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenTheGuysWantHim): If both were romanced in the previous games, Kaidan subtly hints that he finds Jacob attractive.

[Everyone Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneHasStandards): Dislikes mercenaries and assassins, which causes some initial friction when Thane comes aboard. [Though he says nothing about the far more mercenary Zaeed due to the latter being a DLC addition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation).

[Expert Consultant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpertConsultant): He refuses reinstatement in the Alliance Marines after being rescued on Gellix, feeling his time with Cerberus disqualifies him. Instead he becomes their consultant on Cerberus tactics.

[Female Gaze](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FemaleGaze): There's a point [early in the romance](http://youtu.be/z03cL5ZzhkA) in which the camera seems to switch to Shepard's POV, and pans up from his groin to his face.

[Forgot About His Powers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForgotAboutHisPowers): A relatively minor example in *3*: He still handles guns well when Cerberus attacks the defectors' safehouse, but apparently completely forgets he has biotic powers, specifically Barrier,  (SPOILER)  which would have prevented him from receiving the wound that puts him out of action for most of the mission . In fact, he never once discusses being a biotic at all until the party in *Citadel*, where it might get brought up depending on whether the party is noisy or quiet.
[Form-Fitting Wardrobe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FormFittingWardrobe): Almost to the same degree as Miranda.

[The Generic Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGenericGuy): One of the most straightforward party members with the least amount of baggage.  (SPOILER)  The Shadow Brokers files later reveal that this is his speculation on why Jacob was specifically recruited by the Illusive Man to join the squad.

[The Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeart): He and Miranda serve as the foils/voice-of-reason towards Shepard. Jacob is the paragon-voice point, supporting actions that are morally right but risky.

[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): Literally, with *Mass Effect Galaxy*. This put him in the rare position of a previous player character stuck as second-fiddle to another one.
[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Apparently he's good at arcade games if the Citadel DLC is anything to go by.

[Hypocrite](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hypocrite):
    - Despite acting as a hired gun himself, Jacob hates assassins and doesn't hesitate to make his feelings known to Thane. - He is livid if you dump him for another guy in *2*, but cheats on you with another woman in *3*.

tropeName: I Can't Believe a Guy Like You Would Notice Me
tropeNotes: [I Can't Believe a Guy Like You Would Notice Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ICantBelieveAGuyLikeYouWouldNoticeMe): He seems rather surprised when female Shepard tries to start a romance with him, but eventually runs with it.

[I Have No Son!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IHaveNoSon):  (SPOILER) Inverted. He disowns his father after discovering what he did. 
QUOTE **Jacob**:  (SPOILER)  I don't know who you are, because you're no father that I remember .

tropeName: I'll Pretend I Didn't Hear That
tropeNotes: [I'll Pretend I Didn't Hear That](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IllPretendIDidntHearThat): When Grunt starts talking about how appetizing the smell of burning plague victims is.

[Informed Attractiveness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InformedAttractiveness): Depicted as being a [Chick Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChickMagnet), but is an extremely unpopular choice for romance amongst players. In polls over favorite romance options, he rates lower than  (SPOILER)  [Morinth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutWithABang)  !
[Insecure Love Interest](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InsecureLoveInterest): With both Shepard and Miranda, he doesn't believe he's good enough for them.

tropeName: I Want My Beloved to Be Happy
tropeNotes: [I Want My Beloved to Be Happy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWantMyBelovedToBeHappy): Implies this towards Miranda. "She... requires a better man than I."

[Jerkass Ball](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkassBall):
    - He's openly hostile toward Thane when the guy joins the ship. Unlike the conflicts between Jack and Miranda, or Tali and (SPOILER) Legion , Thane isn't confrontational towards him. Jacob just *really* hates assassins. - Also happens if you romanced him in *2*, as he winds up becoming the only love interest in the entire series to cheat on Shepard. And while he'll acknowledge that his actions are wrong, he's still not particularly apologetic about it. Alleviated a bit if confronted about this in the Citadel DLC, as he'll give a more sincere apology and make his guilt more known. - Jacob's response to Shepard ending their romance in favor of pursuing Garrus. While it is understandable for Jacob to be unhappy in that situation, he becomes the only love interest in the series to ever call one of his romantic rivals a racial slur.

[Jerkass to One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkassToOne): While reserved, he's still polite and friendly to the other members of the squad. With Thane however, he doesn't hesitate to make his dislike known. He also throws a few insults at Tali when she's brought aboard, and will drop a turian racial slur if Femshep has been flirting with both him and Garrus but chooses to go with the latter.

[Knight in Sour Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightInSourArmor): He's generally a nice guy, but displays a *lot* of cynicism regarding the Alliance and Citadel governments after the events of *Mass Effect Galaxy* which led him to join Cerberus in disgust. Not that he's altogether fond of *them*, either.
QUOTE  "Saved the Citadel, but... what's the saying? A good deed's like pissing in dark pants. Warm feeling, but no one notices."
[The Knights Who Say "Squee!"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheKnightsWhoSaySquee): He's a bit of a Shepard [Fanboy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fanboy).
[The Lancer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLancer): A position he shares with Garrus and Miranda, hence why he and they are the only ideal candidates for leading the fireteams on the Suicide Mission.

[Leave Behind a Pistol](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeaveBehindAPistol): At the end of his loyalty mission, the Renegade conclusion is to give a gun to  (SPOILER) his father  to kill himself rather than face a court-martial or be killed by males driven to violence by the local flora.

[Luke, You Are My Father](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LukeYouAreMyFather): In his loyalty mission,  (SPOILER) Ronald Taylor has been living in his own fantasy world for so long that he doesn't even recognize Jacob as his own son until Jacob directly introduces himself .
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Both a capable soldier and a powerful biotic.

[Man Hug](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManHug): How he assures Shepard he's ready to go post-loyalty mission.
QUOTE **Jacob:** I'm good, Shepard! Ready for anything. We live, we'll get loud, spill some drinks on the Citadel!

[Military Maverick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MilitaryMaverick): He left the Alliance because he couldn't handle all the [Obstructive Bureaucrats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObstructiveBureaucrat). Having said that, he also gets the prize for the other half of the trope: of all the party members, he holds himself to the strongest level of military behavior, and is the *only* person on the ship aside from Kelly (and a loyal Miranda, *once* if not romanced) who actually salutes Shepard.
[Mind over Matter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MindOverMatter): Jacob is the closest Shepard's squad gets to an average human biotic.

[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): Early in *2*. Justified because he's the only person around Shepard can talk to, and Shep's been dead for two years. He also lampshades and lightly deconstructs it by reacting incredulously to Shepard wanting to play twenty questions while they're being shot at.

[Mr. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFanservice): Why, hello there, [Mr. Unnecessary In Camera Focus Shirt Removal Ripped Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BuffySpeak). His abs are rendered with more detail than some character's faces. Shadow Broker info shows that he's *earned* those abs with an insane workout schedule. His taut ass is also prominent in some shots (the same camera angle as Miranda's Ass Cam, no less).

[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy):
    - One of the nicest members of [Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilInc) Shepard meets. Though he does show some anti-alien sentiments against some of the non-human members of the team aside from Mordin and Grunt (the former he respects, and the latter he's simply not dumb enough to antagonize). - This trope becomes downplayed in the last game if you had romanced him before, as Jacob is revealed to have cheated on Shepard, which he only passively apologizes for. The Citadel DLC helps bring him closer to this trope though where he can make a stronger effort to rebuild bridges with his ex.

[Not Good with Rejection](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotGoodWithRejection): If Shepard starts a romance but breaks things off and hooks up with Garrus, he takes it poorly, hurling an anti-turian racial slur and making it clear that he has lost all respect for Shepard (despite her being completely honest and open with him). He reacts similarly badly if Shepard leaves Jacob for Thane, with Jacob's word choice ("the *drell*?!) implying that his displeasure is less due to his personal dislike of Thane and more that Shepard is romancing someone outside her species. It comes across as especially hypocritical given that he automatically cheats on Shepard in *3* and expects her to simply be okay with it.

tropeName: Not in This for Your Revolution
tropeNotes: [Not in This for Your Revolution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotInThisForYourRevolution): He doesn't care for Cerberus's agenda or their insanely dodgy ideas. He's with them because at the moment, they're doing something about the Collector abductions.

[Oblivious to Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviousToLove): Not only does Shepard pretty much have to explicitly state her interest in him for it to register, but, by all accounts, he also doesn't seem to realize that Kasumi wants to jump his bones. Of course, since she's a downloadable character, he has no dialogue related to her so it's hard to tell.
[Only Sane Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlySaneMan): The Illusive Man placed him on Shepard's team for relative emotional stability as much as skill.

[Overshadowed by Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OvershadowedByAwesome): Never commented on, but while Jacob is an excellent soldier, he's easily outclassed by every other squadmate in terms of exceptional feats.
[Platonic Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlatonicLifePartners): With Miranda and a Female Shepard who befriends him but doesn't romance him.
[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): Aside from Grunt and Shepard themselves, he's the only one with Incendiary Ammo.

[Plot Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlotArmor): Despite being the least exceptional character in the [Player Party](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayerParty), he's also one of the safest: if he doesn't die at the Collector Base, he doesn't die. He is, in fact, the *only* member of the Suicide Squad who is guaranteed to make it to London if you do their [Side Quest](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SideQuest) in the third game.

[Precision F-Strike](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecisionFStrike): An "S-Strike", to be more accurate. Shortly after the cutscene where Shepard releases Jack from cryo, as the squad enters a wrecked room with a few Blue Suns enemies fighting off escaped prisoners, Jacob will blurt out "Holy shit!" in face of all the chaos and destruction.
[Privateer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Privateer): A former member of the Corsairs, a black ops unit that the Alliance could disavow knowledge of if they were caught.

[Properly Paranoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProperlyParanoid): Can be closed off and guarded, Shepard having to do some prodding just to get him to talk, but if called on it he apologizes, saying it's a requirement working with Cerberus.
[Red Oni, Blue Oni](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedOniBlueOni): The easy-going and polite red to Miranda's closed-off and frigid blue.

[Remember the New Guy?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RememberTheNewGuy): He makes a few passing references to having fought the Geth on Eden Prime, but he's neither seen nor mentioned in *Mass Effect 1*, despite Shepard's squad having cleared the entire op zone.

[Shell-Shocked Veteran](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShellShockedVeteran): Bring him along to the Derelict Reaper and you'll learn that he hasn't gotten over Eden Prime as much you initially thought. During the Citadel party, he'll mention that he still has nightmares about the Collector base.
[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): He tends to express less emotion than most of the characters.

[That Man Is Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThatManIsDead): His opinion of Ronald Taylor; no matter how the mission plays out, you'll hear some variation of it. "I've already mourned the man he used to be."

[Token Good Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenGoodTeammate): Jacob is nowhere near as shady as most Cerberus operatives are, and he knows it. More importantly, so does the Illusive Man;  (SPOILER) Jacob was placed aboard the Normandy specifically as a stabilizing element. ...And to make Cerberus seem more trustworthy .

[Took a Level in Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInJerkass): In *3*, if romanced previously he is shown to have  (SPOILER) cheated on Shepard with Dr. Cole in the six months she was incarcerated . Even *he* admits he was a bastard for doing so if Shepard chooses to call him on it (though in a fairly casual manner).
[Transhuman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Transhuman): Par for the course when one is able to project mass effect fields from your body.

[Unknown Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnknownRival): Jacob actively tries to get a rise out of Thane, for no obvious reason. Somewhat humorously, Jacob claims to be loyal to "more than his next paycheck," despite both missions Thane undertakes during *2* being pro-bono. Thane remains unbothered by his behavior and does nothing to provoke Jacob in return.
["Well Done, Son" Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WellDoneSonGuy): He does a good job of not showing it, though.

[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): It's downplayed, but he'll show discomfort if you go out of your way to be vindictive (even if the "victim" is an intel trader who once sent Jacob into an ambush). Played for laughs in the Citadel  DLC ; pick James's side in the "physique vs biotics" argument, and he'll call it the first questionable decision he's *ever* seen you make. Keep in mind, Jacob is the most physically fit member of the *Normandy* aside from James, since Shadow Broker reports show he does strenuous workouts.

tropeName: What You Are in the Dark
tropeNotes:
[What You Are in the Dark](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatYouAreInTheDark): His backstory is full of this. He doesn't mind so much.
QUOTE **Jacob:** Good deed's like pissing yourself in dark pants. Warm feeling, but no one notices.

[Working with the Ex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorkingWithTheEx): In his words, his previous work with Miranda "got a little close — then it got really far apart." They're still on good terms, and (SPOILER) she gives him the plot hook for his character mission to keep a promise. If he could only remember *which* promise...
    - And in *3*, (SPOILER) with Shepard, if you romanced him in the last game .
[You Don't Look Like You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouDontLookLikeYou): Looks *completely* different in *Galaxy*.
[Affectionate Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffectionateNickname): She calls Shepard "Shep."

[Ambiguously Bi](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyBi): She deeply loved Keiji, and spies on Jacob while he's working out, but she also makes some admiring comments about Miranda's body, and stares rather openly at female Shepard's cleavage during her loyalty mission. This is taken further in *Citadel*, where  (SPOILER) she offers to record Miranda and Jack "working out their sexual tension" (though she does that to a lot of the crew, like Tali, for the *ME* equivalent of  YouTube  hits) and roots through Shepard's underwear drawer, regardless of the commander's gender .

[Animal Motif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalMotif): It's very understated, but Kasumi resembles a bird with her cloak. It's only accentuated when leaping with pigeons flying around her onto Hock's gunship.

[Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero): Despite being a shameless career kleptomaniac, she was willing to place herself in severe danger to protect a young artist purely on principle. She has a caring side, often showing concern for the rest of the squad. Of course, given that you have a squad of mercs, terrorists, [Knights Templars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightTemplar) and berserkers, her thieving seems pretty benign in comparison.
    - In *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)*, (SPOILER) she helps the salarian Spectre agent assigned to hunt her down stop an indoctrinated hanar diplomat from dooming his entire species . - In the *Citadel* DLC, she's robbing a casino and intends to give the loot to the war refugees.
[Ascended Fangirl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedFangirl): In-universe; describes herself as a fan of Shepard when she first meets them.

[Backstab](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Backstab): Her signature ability, called Shadow Strike. Less of an actual Backstab, but more "[bop people with the omni-tool](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TapOnTheHead)".

[Blade Enthusiast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeEnthusiast): You never see her using them in-game, but she gets very...*enthused* over a selection of knives on Tuchanka, and contemplates "borrowing" them sometime later.
[Calling Card](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CallingCard): In her early career, she left a rose in place of what she stole. Her partner eventually made her realize how unproductive this is for a thief.
[The Caper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCaper): Her activity of choice. Naturally, her loyalty mission is one.

[Covert Pervert](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CovertPervert):
    - She admits to using her cloak in order to spy on Jacob while he's working out. - Given her rather accurate comments about whoever Shepard chose to romance, it's entirely possible she might have been secretly watching during their romance scene. Case in point — her comment after Shepard sleeps with Miranda: QUOTE **Kasumi:** Oh, Shepard. The engine room? Really? Down there where Tali works? Okay, I gotta ask... just how genetically modified is she? Because -— wow. - (SPOILER) In the *Citadel DLC* for *3*, she can be found during the party checking Shepard's drawers to find out what kind of underwear they wear. Apparently she does this with everyone. She spends the whole party reminiscing about Jacob's crunches, admiring James's muscles, and offering to record Jack and Miranda working out their "sexual tension". The only "covert" part is her turning invisible again before they can react .
      - Javik will chuckle it's cute that Kasumi [thinks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSell) *he* can't see her.
[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): Wears mostly black but is in fact one of the nicest and friendliest of all the party members.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker)
    - On Korlus, regarding Rana Thanoptis: QUOTE **Kasumi:** She seems nice... in a mad scientist ethics-for-sale kind of way. - On the Citadel: QUOTE **Kasumi:** They're really selling the ["geth did it"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GasLeakCoverup) message. I bet you can't even say "Reapers" without inciting a panic. *[[airquote gesture](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging)]* *"Reapers!"*

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): While most of the *[Mass Effect 2](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect2)* squadmates have smaller roles in *3*, Zaeed and Kasumi suffer the most from it, likely due to being DLC characters. At the very least, having both of them keeps you from choosing between war assets.

[Does Not Like Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoesNotLikeSpam): The *Citadel* DLC reveals that she's slightly lactose-intolerant, having mistaken the milk in Shep's fridge to be made of soy. <sup>note </sup>  An unsurprising fact, since 73% of Japanese people are lactose-intolerant. 
QUOTE  "I'm not really lactose-intolerant. I just don't put up with lactose's stupid drama."
[Downloadable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent): She does not appear in the vanilla game at all.

[Eating the Eye Candy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatingTheEyeCandy): Kasumi certainly appreciates Jacob.
QUOTE **Kasumi:** [Ab] crunches. *Lots* of crunches.

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): Unlike the other squad members, who meet you face to face, Kasumi insists on talking to you through a hacked Citadel advertisement. She then reveals she's been watching the whole time, and leans over a railing above Shepard to introduce herself in person.

[Face Framed in Shadow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceFramedInShadow): Aside from the glint of her eyes and occasionally, like in the above picture, enough light to tell she looks normal under the hood, we never see the top half of her face.

[Faking the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FakingTheDead): In *[Mass Effect 3](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/MassEffect3)*,  (SPOILER)  after helping you (and another Spectre who's trying to arrest her), she "activates an explosive failsafe" on a terminal and collapses in a bloody heap. The Spectre is fooled, but Shepard sees right through it. A good way to introduce the new Decoy ability .
[Fangirl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fangirl): "Good to finally meet you, Commander Shepard. Kasumi Goto. I'm a fan."

[Friend to All Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendToAllChildren): She's a nice person in general, but she seems pretty fond of children in particular — the quickest way to get on her bad side is to injure or traumatize a child. One of her anecdotes involves a rare wholly charitable act, which was to rescue a child from slavery, and seeing what Jack and other biotic children went through on Pragia is enough to reduce her to tears.

[The Gambling Addict](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGamblingAddict): The only time she's not sneaking around at the party is if you host a card game, where she'll finally settle down and join Liara and James for a hand of poker.
[Genki Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenkiGirl): Despite being a master thief, she's very enthusiastic and cheerful.

[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): She's excellent at incapacitating enemies up close, but she has low health and shields while her main ability often puts her in dangerous situations. Very inconvenient especially on her loyalty mission, where she is your only squadmate.
[Gossipy Hens](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GossipyHens): If Shepard talks to her on the *Normandy*, she gossips about the other crewmembers and talks about rumors.

[Highly-Visible Ninja](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HighlyVisibleNinja): In her loyalty mission, she strolls right up to Hock's estate in her [Spy Catsuit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpyCatsuit), not even bothering to take her hood down, and seems surprised when Hock turns her away. She then uses her invisibility to get into the building anyway.

[Hikikomori](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hikikomori):  (SPOILER) If Keiji's graybox was kept and the Synthesis ending was not chosen, Kasumi spends the rest of her days as a shut-in reliving Keiji's memories over and over.

[Hyper-Awareness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HyperAwareness): While this is probably more likely due to her stealth skills, Kasumi is one of two Normandy passenger who would know  (SPOILER)  Morinth was posing as Samara, if Samara is killed in her loyalty mission.

[Hypocritical Humor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HypocriticalHumor): During the Hock heist, she notes that his password, "Peruggia", refers to [Vincenzo Peruggia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincenzo_Peruggia), the man who stole the Mona Lisa back in the 1880's. (SPOILER) The Shadow Broker DLC reveals that she has also stolen the Mona Lisa, *[but is offering it for sale.](http://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Shadow_Broker_Dossiers/Kasumi_Goto)* As well as *the [Koh-i-Noor Diamond](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koh-i-Noor)* and a number of other alien artifacts that are presumably as valuable.
[In the Hood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InTheHood): Kasumi wears a hood at all times so no one can ever really see her face.
[Invisibility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Invisibility): Uses the same invisibility device as the player Infiltrator.

tropeName: I Want My Beloved to Be Happy
tropeNotes:
[I Want My Beloved to Be Happy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWantMyBelovedToBeHappy): She has a crush on [Jacob](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy), but will support female Shepard if she decides to romance him. Dump him though and you get this.
QUOTE [You dumped Jacob?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero) I know you have a galaxy to save, **[but you have SEEN Jacob. Right?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FemaleGaze)**

[It's All About Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllAboutMe): Shades of this in *3* where she resents Shepard's recruiting her for the Suicide Mission and reacts quite hostile when they intend to recruit her for the war effort (something that is important to save the entire *galaxy*, no less). Taken further if Shepard chose to preserve Keiji's Graybox, stating she would rather spend her remaining time with Keiji's memories, whereas if it's destroyed she'll give a more self-depressive reasoning by noting a thief like her wouldn't be any good with the Reapers (which is justifiable, since everything of theirs has a tendency to indoctrinate people). While she does agree to help the Crucible project in the end, the promise of being allowed to steal some expensive tech for herself was probably a main reason for that.

[Just a Machine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustAMachine): Subtle but present.
QUOTE **Kasumi:** Sometimes [EDI] seems like a person, but when it comes down to it, I can't get past her being a computer. <br data-format="\\"/><br data-format="\\"/>**Kasumi:** *(on the heretics)* Killed or remade, what's the difference? They're only synthetics. Just fancy security mechs.

[Just Like Robin Hood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustLikeRobinHood): In "Citadel", Shepard can walk in on her about to pull a heist on the Silver Coast Casino. She's not doing it for the money or the fun. She plans on giving the loot to refugees, since she feels that they need it more than the Casino owners. Also, if she becomes a war asset, it's all but stated that she assists by stealing valuable components from Cerberus and giving them to the scientists on the Crucible.

[Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal): If you didn't go on her loyalty mission at all,  (SPOILER) her death's not fake. Shepard simply looks on and then walks away. Of course, maybe she's faking her death towards *Shepard* too, but she certainly doesn't join your list of war assets .

[Kleptomaniac Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KleptomaniacHero): One quality she *definitely* shares with Shepard. Shepard can convince her to help with building the Crucible in *3* by playing on her kleptomania, saying after the job is done, there will be plenty of expensive tech that won't be missed; Kasumi is especially pleased.

[Kleptomaniac Hero Found Underwear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KleptomaniacHeroFoundUnderwear): *Literally*. You can catch her snooping through Shepard's intimates during the party in Anderson's apartment!

[Lampshade Hanging](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging): When commenting on female Shepard's romance with Garrus, she notes that "a lot of people want to see (them) together". She also lampshades the Turian Councilor's infamous "we have dismissed that claim" moment.
[Le Parkour](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeParkour): [Briefly shows off some moves in her loyalty mission.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutscenePowerToTheMax)

[The Lost Lenore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLostLenore): She never completely gets over Keiji's death.  (SPOILER) It actually gets *worse* in  ME3  if you allowed her to keep the greybox .  (SPOILER) And then proceeds to get much, much better if you choose the Synthesis ending, as Keiji's greybox is affected and *he returns to life.*
[Lovable Rogue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LovableRogue): She's very endearing for a self-admitted kleptomaniac.

[Magikarp Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagikarpPower): She starts out very weak. With the right allocation of skill points, she becomes a devastating [Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon).

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName):
    - Kasumi is a Japanese name that means simply "mist". KASUMI is also the name of a cipher used in electronic security. - The Japanese word "goto", the same word as her surname and which is pronounced mostly the same, also means "robber" or "robbery."

[Meet Cute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeetCute): When examining one of the paintings in her quarters, she'll tell you how she acquired it. She was hired to steal it, and when she went to take it, it had already been stolen. As she was leaving, she saw another thief with the painting, chased him down and tackled him. The other thief was Keiji, and he and Kasumi ended up as partners in crime as well as lovers. Neither of their clients ever did get the painting, because they kept it as a memento.

[Moving Beyond Bereavement](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MovingBeyondBereavement): When first introduced, is revealed to be mourning for Keiji Okuda; as such, her loyalty mission is a heist mission to steal back Keiji's graybox from his murderer, ostensibly for the secret that got him killed. Once Kasumi finally makes off with the prize, it becomes clear that she also wants the graybox for the memories of their time together... but then Keiji's final message advises her to delete the contents so that the secret he learned won't endanger her as well, a reveal that leaves Kasumi overwhelmed with grief for the first time in the story. Shepard then has a choice between advising her to abide by Keiji's last wish or to keep the graybox; in the case of the latter,  (SPOILER)  Kasumi will become obsessed with reliving the memories and degenerate into a recluse , while in the case of the former,  (SPOILER)  she will gradually be able to move on.

[Nerf](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Nerf): Her "Shadow Strike" ability, which was basically "teleporting behind an enemy and knocking him down hard", got changed into the "Tactical Cloak" ability in the Citadel DLC.
[Never Bareheaded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverBareheaded): She never lowers her hood, and even the upper part of her face is usually framed in shadow.

[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): Minus the whole "stealing everything in sight" thing, Kasumi is one of the most openly friendly members of your crew. She spends the entire party in *Citadel* messing with the rest of the crew. She's far more lighthearted and fun than Jack being a nasty [Troll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll), making Kasumi this.
[The Nicknamer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheNicknamer): She calls Shepard 'Shep' on a variety of occasions and designates the Illusive Man as 'Mr. Illusive.'

[Not Me This Time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotMeThisTime): If you set off the scanners on the Citadel on your first visit with her in your party.
QUOTE **Kasumi:** I swear to God, I didn't touch anything.

tropeName: Not in This for Your Revolution
tropeNotes: [Not in This for Your Revolution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotInThisForYourRevolution): In *3*, she's not interested in putting her life on the line to fight the Reapers. Her mind can be changed by simply stating she doesn't need to be on the front lines — her computer skills are a big enough asset, and Cerberus facilities are more vulnerable targets to her predations than the Reapers... that and there is also a *lot* on the  (SPOILER)  Crucible  for her to steal.
[Odd Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddFriendship): As a Spectre, Shepard technically is a galactic lawman, while Kasumi is a galactic master-thief.

[Optional Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalPartyMember): As a DLC character. In the *Legendary Edition*, the DLC comes installed anyway, but Kazumi isn't required to progress in the game.
[Outlaw Couple](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutlawCouple):  (SPOILER) With her former partner, Keiji .
[Perky Goth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PerkyGoth): Her outfit is of a design normally associated with dark, brooding characters, but she's actually usually pretty cheerful and playful.

[The Pollyanna](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePollyanna): She always reflects that things could be worse... even when trapped inside a derelict Reaper with dozens of husks that's slowly crashing into a star. Hey, at least it's not full of rats!
    - But take her with you on Jack's loyalty mission, and the thought of children being experimented on horrifies her beyond words.

[Phantom Thief](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhantomThief): She's one of the galaxy's best thieves/hackers, but has no criminal record. On her loyalty mission, Kasumi even says that no one knows what she looks like.

[Playful Hacker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayfulHacker):
    - She greets Shepard by taking over one of the Citadel's advertising terminals. Her hacking skills are actually on-par with both Legion and Tali. - If Shepard ignores her, she has half a dozen humorous comments from being a credit agency for help with collector agents to the offer of a sweet Japanese girl, before getting mad if Shepard doesn't bite. QUOTE **Ad!Kasumi:** OK, really? [How many times can you walk by without stopping?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellPlayer) - She even starts helping the Spectre sent to arrest her with one of his investigations *just because*. - For that matter she plays around with this at the party in Citadel, from imitating Jacob doing crunches to helping him win a push up contest against James to raiding Shepard's underwear drawer. - When Shepard bumps into her in the Silver Coast Casino in *Citadel*, she casually hacks several Quasar machines to give big payouts to the players, just because she can.
[Recruiting the Criminal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecruitingTheCriminal): Cerberus seeks her out to use her skills against the Collectors.

[Shipper on Deck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipperOnDeck): Shipper on the Port Observation Deck, to be exact. Kasumi is one of the more emotionally intelligent squadmates.
    - She points out that EDI and Joker bicker [Like an Old Married Couple](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LikeAnOldMarriedCouple) even before (SPOILER) EDI is unshackled , and *well* before (SPOILER) they actually hook up in Mass Effect 3 . - She comments on how Ken and Gabby [are the only people who don't seem to realize how perfect they are for one another](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneCanSeeIt). - She'll ship Shepard with any of the applicable love interests in ME2 , especially Tali and Garrus. Humorously, she makes a point of saying that ["a lot of people" want to see Garrus and Shepard together](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging).

[Shown Their Work](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShownTheirWork): Throughout the party segment of the *Citadel* DLC there's a [Running Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RunningGag) about Kasumi's lactose intolerance. Kasumi is one of few characters in *Mass Effect* of explicitly Japanese ancestry. It just so happens [ethnically Japanese people have some of the highest rates of lactose intolerance in the world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lactase_persistence#Global_spread_of_the_lactase_persistence_phenotype) at 95%.
[The Smart Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmartGuy):  (SPOILER) Along with Tali and Legion, she's an ideal choice for the Tech Expert during the suicide mission .
[The Sneaky Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSneakyGuy) / [Stealth Expert](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StealthExpert): "Now you see me..."

[Spy Catsuit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpyCatsuit): Her outfit is as form-fitting as Miranda's. She even lampshades it by commenting that one of the Cerberus Security guys keeps watching her; she's used to being eyeballed by security, but they're [usually watching her face or her hands](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaleGaze).

[Stealth Hi/Bye](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StealthHiBye): Her special ability involves this.
QUOTE **Kasumi:** Now you see me...
[Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood): She loves ramen, and regrets not having stolen her grandmother's recipe.
[Unrequited Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnrequitedLove): She has a crush on Jacob, even by the time of *3*, where he is expecting a child by Dr. Brynn Cole.

[Unscrupulous Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnscrupulousHero): She's no kind of evil, but she is a thief and a rather selfish individual, with little interest in putting her neck on the line for anyone else. She joins Shepard in *2* to get allies for her own loyalty mission, and in *3*, tries to [Opt Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptOut) of joining the war against the Reapers because it's really not her kind of job.

[What the Hell, Player?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellPlayer): Ignore Kasumi on the Citadel when she's pretending to be a station advertisement, and she'll drop the [Spy Speak](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpySpeak) and call Shepard out to meet with her already, dammit.

[Worthy Opponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponent):
    - She considers Spectre Jondum Bau one, and, in fact, forwarded the information on the possibly indoctrinated hanar diplomat to him, claiming the galaxy needs more men like him. Even as he's trying to arrest her. QUOTE **Kasumi:** Nobody's perfect. - The feeling's mutual — Jondum openly admires her. QUOTE **Jondum Bau:** Her intelligence and skill [are almost salarian](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreACreditToYourRace).

[Action Film, Quiet Drama Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionFilmQuietDramaScene): Personal mission involves one. [In which](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InWhichATropeIsDescribed) Mordin considers actions. Reasons for becoming [Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner) also stated. Done fairly well.
[Affectionate Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffectionateNickname): Referred to by Urdnot Wrex as "Pyjak". Don't know whether to be insulted or honoured...
[Amazing Freaking Grace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmazingFreakingGrace): Recording of him singing this on his *Citadel* DLC datapad. "Still prefer patter songs."

[Angst? What Angst?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngstWhatAngst):  invoked  Heavily affected by loyalty mission, fine by return to *Normandy*. Salarians possess short lifespans, learn to deal with emotional burdens efficiently. Came to terms during shuttle ride. Concern appreciated, however.  (SPOILER)  Third game suggests [not as "over it" as previously claimed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope), when chance to finish genophage cure is presented.

[The Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner):  (SPOILER) Upgraded genophage. Argues that it was correct choice; does not truly believe it. Perfect reason to atone for. Ultimately [zigzagged](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZigzaggedTrope). Considers act inexcusable, after deliberation. Also considers act inevitable and necessary. In *Mass Effect 3*, fights to save female krogan and cure the genophage. [Does what needs to be done.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice) **Sharp inhale** [Proud posthumously](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedemptionEqualsDeath).

[Awesomeness by Analysis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AwesomenessByAnalysis): Quickly able to deduce Shepard arrived in clinic to find him. Obviously working for Cerberus. Disembodied voice on *Normandy* clearly belongs to an AI.

[Badass Bookworm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBookworm): Salarian doctor. Among smartest ever. Also highly skilled killer. Broken cranial horn and facial scars due to attack by Krogan. Stabbed Krogan with pitchfork through eye. [Continued with mission despite injuries.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator)
[Badass Labcoat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassLabcoat): Wears labcoat over commando gear. *[sharp inhale](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic)* Awesome.

[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): Weaker than normal humans, and on team composed of mostly of superhumans and psychics. Still managed to kill a [krogan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperStrength) with farming equipment.
[Because You Can Cope](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BecauseYouCanCope): Paragon solution if loyalty lost in [Dummied Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DummiedOut) material.
[Beige Prose](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeigeProse): [Naturally.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfDemonstratingArticle) Tried... to... slow... down. No. No no no, can't do it. Too much to do.

[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton):
    - [Playing with Syringes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithSyringes). Hates reckless science. Especially pointless wastes of life. - Also metaphors. No time for metaphors. Requires explanation. No time to waste. - Also can't stand the thought of [Creative Sterility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreativeSterility). Species cannot evolve without art in culture. No art, no life. Collectors have no art, can barely be considered truly alive.

[Beware the Nice Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheNiceOnes): Ran clinic on Omega. Mercs tried to extort a protection racket. They all ended up dead. Was gone five minutes. Hung their bodies on display. **Sharp inhale**. Never bothered again.

[Bizarre Alien Biology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BizarreAlienBiology): Salarians need little sleep. Have almost perfect recall of any learned information. Egg-laying, have little understanding of romantic interaction.
[Black Eyes of Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackEyesOfEvil): Averted. Salarian eyes black, but not evil. Merely ruthless.
[Blood from the Mouth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodFromTheMouth): Third game, if  (SPOILER) murdered by Shepard. Cough up blood from gunshot wound during final crawl towards console.

[Blue-and-Orange Morality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlueAndOrangeMorality): When brought on Legion's loyalty mission, others [see no moral difference between destruction and rewriting of heretics.](https://youtu.be/X_QmG57VwZs) Personally believe if geth are alive, rewriting kinder. Change, not death, like Genophage. Although [willing to consider notion that rewriting into obedience immoral](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope).

[Book Ends](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BookEnds):
    - Introduced in the second game working to cure a plague on Omega. Cure distributed airborne with Shepard's help. (SPOILER) May potentially end the same way in the third game. Worked together with Shepard to distribute the cure to the Genophage airborne via the Shroud. [For the last time.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice) - Played significantly more tragically (SPOILER) if Shepard decides to kill Mordin. Gave an M-6 Carnifex to Shepard as token of goodwill during first meeting. Shepard uses that same Carnifex to shoot Mordin in the back to stop him from curing the Genophage.

[Bond One-Liner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BondOneLiner): Non-lethal example, since victim was merely obstinate STG agent, not actually an enemy. QUOTE **Mordin:** [Objection noted.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=yT_IcAqjYyM#t=30s)

[Break the Comedian](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakTheComedian): Easily most deliberately funny member of team. Loyalty mission and encounter with the consequences of attempted Genophage cure destroys sense of humour, leaves very sombre and depressive... but appears to have recovered by return to normal, claiming faster lifespan allows to process emotions quicker.  (SPOILER)  Third game suggests was lying.

[Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatchPhrase):
    - "X is / likely to be...problematic." - "Had to be me. Someone else might have gotten it wrong."
[Celibate Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CelibateHero): Inherent to salarian biology. Quite knowledgeable regardless.

[Combat Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatMedic): Technically. [Performs medical research on ship, on ground Shepard provides in-game medic abilities.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation)
[Cool Old Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolOldGuy): 30 years old. Salarian life expectancy forty. Roughly same age as Shepard. Find this amusing.
[Covered in Scars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoveredInScars): From time spent as STG operative. Clue as to not being as harmless as it might seem.

[Crazy-Prepared](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrazyPrepared): Ready to give [The Talk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTalk) for any kind of interspecies romance. Ran clinic on [Omega](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WretchedHive) — advice likely necessary there. Many species, many tastes.

[Crisis of Faith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrisisOfFaith): [Studied many religions](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lGBFTlRT3o0#t=0m55s) as means to [atone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner). Looked for answers. Found questions. Declares [Reincarnation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Reincarnation) popular with salarians. Deeply spiritual still. Shepard expresses surprise. QUOTE **Shepard:** I didn't expect spirituality from you, Mordin.
**Mordin:** Genophage modification project altered millions of lives. Then saw results. Ego, humility, juxtaposition. Frailty of life. Size of universe. Explored religions after work was completed. Different races. No answers. Many questions.
**Shepard:** Sounds like you were trying to deal with a guilty conscience. The doctor who killed millions.

[Cruel to Be Kind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CruelToBeKind): Helped  (SPOILER) modify krogan genophage after species adapted to original . Did so for the good of entire galaxy - *including*  (SPOILER) krogan . Models suggested  (SPOILER) krogan resurgence  would result in deaths of thousands, and  (SPOILER) krogan extinction . Modifying  (SPOILER) genophage  only answer. Painfully aware of the contradictions in this argument. Resolving said contradictions a major part of character arc.

[Cultured Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CulturedBadass): Believes culture needs art. Otherwise not culture. Actively fears [Creative Sterility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreativeSterility). Uses as evidence for Collectors not being... alive. No art, no expression. No expression, no soul. *sharp inhale* Also did [Gilbert and Sullivan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/GilbertAndSullivan).

[Dating Catwoman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DatingCatwoman): Hinted at. Has history with crime boss Aria T'loak. Circumstances unclear, but open fondness of Mordin on her part remains. Wrote [Self-Insert Fic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfInsertFic) about breaking Omega's only rule - [in more ways than one](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlapSlapKiss).

[Dead Guy Junior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadGuyJunior):  (SPOILER)  If Wrex is krogan leader and Genophage cured, will suggest honoring Mordin's sacrifice by naming one of his children (maybe a girl) after him. Tone suggests lack of seriousness about endeavor .

[Deadly Doctor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadlyDoctor):
    - Thought he was harmless, did you? QUOTE **Mordin:** Advantage of being salarian. Turians, krogan, vorcha - all obvious threats. *[[sharp inhale](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic)]* [Never see me coming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychoticSmirk). - [Subversion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope), actually. Has killed many times, but **never** with medicine (says so himself during loyalty mission). (SPOILER) Shepard can challenge whether upgraded genophage killing with medicine or not. Likely asked himself same question in past . Paralysing nerve gas followed by lethal projectile to cranium is acceptable, however.
[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Found several surveillance bugs. Destroyed some. Returned expensive one to Miranda.

[Death Faked for You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFakedForYou): If Wrex and Eve dead, can be convinced to  (SPOILER) fake genophage cure and help with Crucible project. Wreav too dangerous as leader without Eve to stabilize him. Pretend to have died in explosion.

[Dead Man Writing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadManWriting): From *Citadel*. In event of death, STG colleagues to deliver datapad to Shepard. Contains greatest hits. Hope Shepard finds them informative, amusing, educational...
[Defiant to the End](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefiantToTheEnd): If  (SPOILER) murdered by Shepard  at end of third game,  (SPOILER) spends last moments crawling towards console to cure genophage .

[Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator): If Shepard forced to  (SPOILER)  shoot him. Manages to crawl toward console despite lethal wound. Almost reaches console before collapsing. Makes it further than replacement if dead in second game .
[Dirty Business](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DirtyBusiness): Guilt for actions major part of character.

[Dying Moment of Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DyingMomentOfAwesome):
    - If deploying genophage cure, quietly hums (SPOILER) [Scientist Salarian](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MajorGeneralSong) while going about work. Facility collapsing around. *[sharp inhale](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic)* ...Exhilarating. - (SPOILER) Inverted if Shepard shoots in back. Crawl to workstation. Die before temperature change ruins cure. Senseless death. Even Shepard disgusted with self .

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): Recruited on Omega. Deduces Shepard's allegiance and intentions within seconds, if not told. Simple logic; process of elimination. Offers cure for plague - and new gun. Also dismisses entire mercenary squad as "minor" attack on clinic. [Solid reasons for this](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredBadass).

[Et Tu, Brute?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EtTuBrute): Third game, if  (SPOILER) Shepard sabotages genophage cure. Disappointed. Betrayed. Possibly subverted if Shepard changes mind at last minute. Also subverted if Wrex and Eve dead; can be convinced Wreav too dangerous to allow access to cure. Downplayed if Shepard honest about reasons for sabotage; decision understandable, if not acceptable.

[Everyone Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneHasStandards):
    - (SPOILER) Hates unnecessary waste of life. Only kills problematic people. Always careful with medicine. Never carries out research on species capable of calculus unless subject volunteers. Protege... [*sharp inhale*](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic) not so principled . - If taken on Jack loyalty mission, repeatedly disgusted by surroundings. Experimenting on children *not* acceptable.

[Evilutionary Biologist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilutionaryBiologist): Downplayed. Involved in  (SPOILER) modification of genophage . Generally well-intentioned, regardless - even towards  (SPOILER) Krogan . Strong ethical guidelines. [Ruthless when guidelines are breached](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodIsNotSoft).
QUOTE **Mordin:** No testing on species capable of calculus. Simple rule. Never broke it.

[Expert Consultant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpertConsultant): Found at Salarian Tasks Group facility on Sur'kesh despite having retired from STG. There as consultant on genophage, working for an actual cure since no one else has expertise, experience or motivation for it. Has to be him, someone else might get it wrong.

[Explain, Explain... Oh, Crap!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExplainExplainOhCrap): Third game if  (SPOILER) Shepard sabotages genophage cure. Try to figure out why Shepard is delaying transmission of cure. Realize sabotage likely. Only plausible culprit... Shepard.
[Face Death with Dignity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceDeathWithDignity): Stands tall and proud while  (SPOILER) Shroud exploding around him.

[Faking the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FakingTheDead): Third game. If Eve dead and Urdnot Wreav sole krogan leader, can be convinced krogan not yet ready for cure.  (SPOILER)  Will disappear to work on Crucible. Shepard lets krogan believe everything went as planned .

[Fire, Ice, Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireIceLightning):
    - [Incinerate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithFire), check. [Cryo Blast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithIce), check. [Neural Shock](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AgonyBeam)? Close enough! - In the third game, proves capable of inflicting electric shocks with omni-tool. [Only in cutscene, though.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutscenePowerToTheMax)
[The Fettered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFettered): Believes strongly in scientific ethics, refuses to experiment on sapient life.

[Film Noir](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FilmNoir): Authored novel in this style. Protagonist, lone STG operative on a mission. Broke number one rule on Omega... in [more ways than one](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReallyGetsAround). Semi-autobiographical? Leave up to audience to decide.

[Frontier Doctor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FrontierDoctor): Reminiscent. Omega resembles frontier setting. Limited resources, hostile factions, difficult for physician of [lesser capability](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBookworm) to practice. [*sharp inhale*](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic) Missed working for operations with a budget.

[Gibbering Genius](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GibberingGenius): [Dictates thought processes in real time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThinkingOutLoud). [Avoids infinitives](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouNoTakeCandle). [Irrelevant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope) if [heard saying inconvenient thought out loud.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidIJustSayThatOutLoud)

[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): Three skills, purely offensive.  (SPOILER)  Also low defence rating. Death during suicide mission likely. Preferable choice for escorting Chakwas and other crew members back to *Normandy* .

[Good Is Not Soft](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodIsNotSoft): No hesitation in purging dangerous elements for greater good. Sees no contradiction in killing some to safeguard others.  (SPOILER) Genophage tests this mentality to the extreme .
[Go Out with a Smile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoOutWithASmile):  (SPOILER)  Restored future of krogan species . Good reason to smile in face of death.

[Headbutting Heroes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeadbuttingHeroes): Previously part of squad under Captain Kirrahe to deliver genophage modifications. Numerous disagreements on mission parameters. Repeatedly called each other '[cloacas](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SophisticatedAsHell)'. Earned respect by end of mission.
[Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD): Upon discovering  (SPOILER) pupil performed tests. Dangerous and reckless, even if misguided.

[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): Third game,  (SPOILER)  salarian sabotage to Shroud revealed. Stay behind to fix it. Die in the process. *[sharp inhale](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic)* Conscience clear. Still... would like to have run tests on the seashells.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Double subverted. Discussion with Shepard regarding Collectors. Disgusted with lack of culture. Personal interest negligible; anger scientific in nature. Culture sign of philosophy, growth, *life*. Still dabbled in singing *[Gilbert and Sullivan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/GilbertAndSullivan)*. "♪I am the very model of a scientist salarian!♪"

tropeName: I Did What I Had to Do
tropeNotes:
[I Did What I Had to Do](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IDidWhatIHadToDo): Subverted. Insists this repeatedly during loyalty mission. Obviously trying to convince self, not companions.
    - Still resolute it was right action. Even against Shepard's best arguments. Invokes [Grey-and-Gray Morality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GreyAndGrayMorality). Actions not unjustified. - Worth remembering alternative was genocide. "Save galaxy from krogan. Save krogan from galaxy." - Also made peace with self after mission. Mind clear. Hands washed. No guilt. Free to focus on task at hand. - Until (SPOILER) sequel. True guilt revealed... and [again overcome.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedemptionEqualsDeath)
[I'll Kill You!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IllKillYou):  (SPOILER) If Maelon spared after loyalty mission, made plain former student *not* forgiven. Will kill if ever encountered again.
[Insistent Terminology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InsistentTerminology): Genophage sterility plague. *Not* murder.

[Insufferable Genius](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InsufferableGenius): Some hints of this. For example, when joining Crucible in *3*: "Exciting atmosphere, galaxy's most brilliant minds working together towards common goal. Read their solutions to engineering problems on the way over. Looking forward to correcting them in person."
[Ironic Echo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IronicEcho): If survived  ME2 ,  (SPOILER)  can die while curing genophage in  ME3  . Uses same lines about how others would have gotten it wrong.
[Irony](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Irony): For all claims of "It had to be me, someone else might have gotten it wrong" regarding Genophage, Padok Wix was able synthesize cure in case of death.

[If It's You, It's Okay](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IfItsYouItsOkay): No interest in Shepard romantically. [If ever explored, Shepard optimal.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A4Fwa-OQ1ao) Either sex. Ahem.

[It's Personal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsPersonal): Deliberately invoked in order to anthropomorphize fight against Collectors and Reapers.
QUOTE **Mordin:** Hard to imagine galaxy. Too many people. Faceless. Statistics. Easy to depersonalize. Good when doing unpleasant work. For this fight, want personal connection. Can't anthropomorphize galaxy. But can think of favorite nephew. Fighting for him.
[Keet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Keet): Described as being like hamster on caffeine. Salarian metabolism much faster than most other species', but fast even for salarians.

[Kick the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickTheDog): Questions Paragon Shepard's willingness to spare batarians who threatened assistant, [sketchy asari neurospecialist](http://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Rana_Thanoptis) as well. Second chances noble, not pragmatic, open possibilities for future betrayals. Correct about Rana Thanoptis. Should have killed her.
[Killed Mid-Sentence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledMidSentence): " (SPOILER) [I am the very model of a--](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DyingMomentOfAwesome) " **BOOM**

[Kill It with Ice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithIce): Uses omnitool to freeze enemies solid. [Thaw quickly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HarmlessFreezing), but [bodies fragile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LiterallyShatteredLives)!

[Kill It with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithFire): Uses omnitool to incinerate enemies. Incredibly deadly. "Flammable! Or inflammable? Forget which. Doesn't matter!" ([Same thing. Really doesn't matter.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/JustForFun/IThoughtItMeant))

[Lampshade Hanging](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging):
    - Meeting Shepard for first time. Attempt to work out why Spectre is here. Renegade interrupt offered. If not taken Paragon interrupt suggested. On board *Normandy* third interrupt option available. *[[sharp inhale](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic)]*. [Allows Shepard to interrupt when heard enough.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin) - Alternatively, can ignore interrupts. Made up for with hilarious scene: QUOTE **Shepard:** Do you ever pause for breath?
    **Mordin:** Sorry. I'll... try... to... slow... down. No-no-no. Can't do it. No time.
[Light Is Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsGood): Wears white in keeping with doctoral nature. Also good. Help people.  (SPOILER)  Cure genophage .

[The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad): Second game. Primary contribution to [Suicide Mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuicideMission) intellectual.  (SPOILER) At Collector Base, poor choice for vent shafts and fire team, even if loyal. Also poor defense value for rearguard. Best assigned to escort surviving Normandy crew to safety.
[Mad Scientist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientist): Not mad. Usually irritable. Sometimes affable.

[Mad Scientist Laboratory](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientistLaboratory): Granted personal lab on *Normandy*. Cerberus spared no expense. Removed by Alliance during *Normandy* retrofit. Pity. Medical Bay will have to suffice. Proves convenient by that time, however. After all,  (SPOILER)  working on genophage cure .

[Major General Song](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MajorGeneralSong): ["I am the very model of a scientist salarian."](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J-HgVM6JSIY)
    - [Voice actor had previous role](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCastShowoff). TV movie production of *[The Pirates of Penzance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Theatre/ThePiratesOfPenzance)*. Makes it funnier. - In third game sings another version. Asari-vorcha crosses have allergy to dairy.
[The Matchmaker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMatchmaker): Tries to hook Eve up with Garrus. Scars, intelligence, aggression. Would've made good match for Eve. Eve declined repeatedly.

[Measuring the Marigolds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeasuringTheMarigolds): Planned to walk on beach, collect seashells on retirement. Shepard asserted would go crazy within hour. Amended plans to run tests on seashells.
[Mercy Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MercyKill): View effort to defeat Collectors as this. Protheans gone, Collectors just final insult.

[A Million Is a Statistic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AMillionIsAStatistic): Trope discussed. Galaxy too broad, too many people, too many variables. Impersonal. Can't fight for whole galaxy. Can picture favorite nephew; can fight for him.
[Morally Ambiguous Doctorate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MorallyAmbiguousDoctorate): Good but conflicted. Did what had to do. Necessary, but still regrets.
[Motor Mouth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MotorMouth): Speaks too fast when met in Omega. Can be halted with renegade interrupt. Can attempt to slow down, but incapable.
[Murder Is the Best Solution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MurderIsTheBestSolution): Mission important. Talking takes too long. At least one way to help people.

tropeName: My God, What Have I Done?
tropeNotes: [My God, What Have I Done?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGodWhatHaveIDone):  (SPOILER) Horrified by personal work on genophage. Still feel it had to be done.

[My Greatest Failure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGreatestFailure): Treats  (SPOILER)  work on genophage  as this, though [not failure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoneHorriblyRight), strictly speaking. Justifies it incessantly. Had to be done. No other option. Only correct and logical course of action...
QUOTE **Mordin**: [I made a MISTAKE!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OOCIsSeriousBusiness) Focused on big picture. Big picture made of little pictures. Too many variables!

tropeName: My Sensors Indicate You Want to Tap That
tropeNotes: [My Sensors Indicate You Want to Tap That](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MySensorsIndicateYouWantToTapThat): Cross-species body language awkward; makes for easy misunderstandings. Movements of Shepard's lower eyelids suggestive by salarian standards. Good to clear air. Also identifies incumbent romantic relations between Shepard and love interests,; offers pertinent medical advice. Scandalized if Shepard views advice as being in jest.

[Never Trust a Trailer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverTrustATrailer): Some fans confused initially. Felt Fight For The Lost trailers implied Mordin [Clint Eastwood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/ClintEastwood) style lone ranger. In game, [quickly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MotorMouth) proven [wrong.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatMedic)

[Nice Job Breaking It, Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceJobBreakingItHero):
    - Narrowly averted. Had cure ready for Joker's Vrolik Syndrome. Luckily double checked in middle of night. Discovered that humans do *not* have two livers! **Sharp inhale** Would have caused liver failure. Problematic. - Paragon Shepard repeatedly insists this is the case with genophage modification project. Vehemently disagree! [Had to be done!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IDidWhatIHadToDo)

[Nightmare Fetishist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NightmareFetishist):
    - Foremost expert in medicine and bioengineering in the galaxy. Knowledgeable of diseases, [sexually transmitted or otherwise](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Squick), of all major sapient races. Often muses about such diseases out loud. Also does experiments. - Intrigue at squad's potential survival on Horizon present even if part of squad.

[Noodle Incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident): Lethal proficiency with [farming equipment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser). Never explained until discovery of [Shadow Broker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent) database;  (SPOILER) Skinny salarian doctor killed charging krogan by driving pitchfork through head. Disappoints fans, who imagined combine harvester .

[Not That Kind of Doctor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotThatKindOfDoctor): Primary specializations genetics and biochemistry. Still often found working in medical fields. Mostly shares intimate knowledge of biology of wide variety of species with people with actual medical expertise, though.

[Odd Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddFriendship):
    - With genophage-immune krogan female. Call her Eve. Part of reason wish to cure genophage. - Also eventually establishes one with Wrex. (SPOILER) Is mourned by Wrex after dying for genophage cure. QUOTE **Wrex:** *(approvingly)* You've got a quad on you, Doctor! Keep her safe.

[Old Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OldSoldier): Elderly by salarian standards. Chronologically same age as Shepard. Find this amusing. Based partly on [older Clint Eastwood, in fact](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y-YqK3s7ivM).

[Omnidisciplinary Scientist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OmnidisciplinaryScientist): Primary focus biomedical. Constantly forays into other sciences. Mechanical expertise surprising. He *is* the very model of a scientist salarian. One exception: limited experience with security systems.  (SPOILER)  Assignment as Tech Specialist unwise .

[O.O.C. Is Serious Business](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OOCIsSeriousBusiness): Pausing while speaking. Long, complete statements. Use of first-person pronouns. All likely indicators of serious topics.
    - (SPOILER) If genophage is to be cured, dialogue with Shepard before they part ways for good: QUOTE **Shepard:** I'm sorry, Mordin.
    **Mordin:** (SPOILER) I'm not. [Had to be me... Someone else might have gotten it wrong](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatchPhrase). - (SPOILER) If genophage cure was to be sabotaged instead: QUOTE **Mordin:** (SPOILER) I MADE A *MISTAKE*! note  Quadruply serious. Never admits mistakes. Or shouts. Or uses determiners. Or refers to self with first person pronouns.

[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog): Loyalty mission. Packed with these moments. Notably  (SPOILER) absolutely horrified at dead female krogan test subject. States that species doesn't matter. Acknowledges work as a cause .
QUOTE  **Shepard:** I didn't expect you to be disturbed by the sight of a dead krogan.<br data-format="\\"/>**Mordin:** *[surprised]* What? Why? Because of genophage work? Irrelevant. No, *causative*.
[The Professor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheProfessor): Nature of mission irrelevant. Know *something* about strange thing.
[Redemption Equals Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedemptionEqualsDeath): Dying while  (SPOILER)  curing genophage  only redemption for  (SPOILER)  modifying it previously.
[Retired Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredBadass): Formerly served in special forces. Now doctor. Return to combat not a problem.

[Retirony](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Retirony):
    - "Would have liked to run tests on the seashells." - (SPOILER) In Extended Cut, if alive, spends final years finding the time to cure the genophage .

[Sacrificial Lion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SacrificialLion): In third game. End of first story act,  (SPOILER)  first major character to die. Clear sign no-one else safe. *inhale* No-one. If killed by Shepard, good sign of how far they have fallen .
[Science Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScienceHero): Uses vast scientific knowledge to help Shepard against both Collectors and Reapers.
[Seen It All](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeenItAll): Has encountered much in the galaxy. Little surprise. Reaction to  (SPOILER)  Javik: "Ah, a Prothean. Excellent."
[Self-Demonstrating Article](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfDemonstratingArticle): Terse talker. Speaks in sentence fragments. Emulated in this character trope list.

[Self-Insert Fic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfInsertFic): Enjoys writing them.
QUOTE **Mordin:** Broke Omega's one rule, in more ways than one. <sup>note </sup>  Rule in question: "Don't fuck with Aria." [Implies sexual activity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DontExplainTheJoke).

[Sherlock Scan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SherlockScan): Good at analysis. Displayed when first met Shepard. Deduces Cerberus affiliation even if not explicitly stated. Recognizes EDI as AI just as quickly.

[Shipper on Deck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipperOnDeck): Ready to offer [medical advice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTalk) for Shepard and their romantic partner. Available to offer gels and instruction manuals for possible cross-species intercourse.
    - Admits worries about implications of [Joker/EDI](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoboShip), however. - Knew that krogan females find scars attractive. Tried to set "Eve" up with Garrus Vakarian. Apparently she wasn't interested. Will do this even if Shepard in relationship with Garrus. Awkward.

[Shoot the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShootTheDog):
    - Has no problem killing one person. To save ten others, of course. (SPOILER) Even created new strain of genophage. Krogan adapted to previous one. Does feel regretful about the latter. Started clinic to atone. All life precious. QUOTE **Mordin:** Lots of ways to help people. Sometimes heal patients; sometimes execute dangerous people. Either way helps. - Also at end of loyalty mission. (SPOILER) Discover former STG agent curing genophage. Must be killed . Can be stopped with Paragon interrupt. QUOTE **Mordin:** No! Not a (SPOILER) murderer . Thank you, Shepard. - (SPOILER) Possibly on receiving end in third game. If not convinced to go along with sabotage, Renegade Shepard forced to shoot him to stop genophage cure .
[Silver Fox](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SilverFox): In final decade of life. Considered attractive by salarian standards. Especially by other species. Receive come-ons *constantly*.
[The Smart Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmartGuy): Runs tech lab. Cannot purchase upgrades without him aboard.

[Sophisticated as Hell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SophisticatedAsHell): Noted in Shadow Broker Dossier. Example adequate:
QUOTE  "*Specialist Solus suggests Commander Kirrahe has a foreign object in his cloaca <sup>note </sup>  he has a stick up his ass.  [...] suggests that cloacal obstruction is in fact Kirrahe's cranium. <sup>note </sup>   he has his head up his ass. *"

[The Spock](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSpock): Usually goes with more logical path. Belief in killing those who present themselves as threat. [Deconstructed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeconstructedTrope) during Loyalty mission.  (SPOILER)  Genophage involvement becomes source of conflict .

[Squishy Wizard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SquishyWizard):
    - Skills quite useful in combat, but shields and health quite weak. Survival requires support. - Despite special forces training and career, implied to possess weakest combat capabilities of any of the ground team. (SPOILER) Lowest combat score and survival priority of any loyal teammate in holding the line against the Collectors. Lower than even Jack and Tali, who both are specialized at fighting enemies other than Collectors. Escorted duty recommended. Alternately, take to final confrontation. Tech abilities effective against armored targets. Collector forces feature many armored opponents. If loyal, will definitely survive if taken with Shepard.

[Strange-Syntax Speaker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrangeSyntaxSpeaker): [Obviously](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfDemonstratingArticle). Speaks mainly in sentence fragments, never uses first-person pronouns.  (SPOILER) Possible defence mechanism to avoid taking responsibility for genophage enhancements - only breaks established pattern when admitting own mistakes.

[Stupid Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StupidGood): Third game, if  (SPOILER) Wrex and Eve dead. Blinded by need to atone for genophage enhancements. Unable to see threat Wreav would pose without genophage or Eve to keep in check unless Shepard provide wake-up call.

[Suddenly Shouting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuddenlyShouting): Third game. Rare loss of emotional control in regards to genophage enhancements.
QUOTE *"I MADE A MISTAKE!!!"*

[The Talk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTalk):
    - Shown [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mAP92rvm1hQ), on [Interspecies Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterspeciesRomance). Try not to "ingest". Offers for all romances. Promises to "probe" Jacob/Miranda. Cerberus could have bugs *anywhere*... - Third game takes this step further. Offers (SPOILER) Joker advice on proposed (SPOILER) [robosexual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Robosexual) liaison with EDI. All part of profession.

[Teeth-Clenched Teamwork](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeethClenchedTeamwork): With Urdnot Wreav. Mutual dislike obvious. Cooperation necessity for curing Genophage. Payback acquired during tissue sample collection.
QUOTE **Wreav:** He failed to mention how he was gonna take his tissue sample. This ship doesn't have enough painkillers for where he cut me!

[Technobabble](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Technobabble): Constantly. Combines with [Terse Talker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TerseTalker), [Motor Mouth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MotorMouth). Some complain of difficulty understanding. Get doctorate! Have real conversation!

[Terse Talker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TerseTalker): Talks fast and short. [First part natural to salarians](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MotorMouth). Second part peculiar to himself. Likes [Techno Babble](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TechnoBabble) dialogue. Always [Thinking Out Loud](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThinkingOutLoud). Reading [Self-Demonstrating Article](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfDemonstratingArticle) right now. *[sharp inhale](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic)* May help you understand.

[Thinking Out Loud](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThinkingOutLoud): Constantly. Annoying to krogan female in *3*. QUOTE **Mordin:** [Who's that?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yMA6F4-YAfw) Pilot? No. Synthesized voice. Simulated emotional inflections. Could it be... no. Maybe. Have to ask. Is that an AI?
